Deep House vibe x Electronique. Des idées de mood Tech x Deep. Une instrumentale un peu discrète. Un kick/drum kit un peu trop basic, il faut s'en servir pour créer plus de mouvement dans le morceau - pas juste un kick/snare/kick/snare. Des bonnes bases instrumentales, proprement exécutés. Maintenant il faut passer au niveau supérieur en modifiant les sonorités 'presets' des synthétiseurs et gagner en originalité. Tout le monde fait de la deep house, qu'est-ce qui fait qu'une personne va plus s'attarder sur la tienne qu'une autre? Il faut leur donner une raison.

Bonjour LeSirconspect
Tout d’abord toute l’équipe Cul7ure te remercie pour l’envoi de ton morceau « Le monde ou l'on vit» et la confiance que tu nous accordes. 
Après plusieurs écoutes attentives, nous pouvons te faire le retour suivant. Dans l’ensemble le morceau est bien produit. Le choix de la prod correspond bien à l'ambiance un peu froide du morceau et te laisse suffisamment de place pour t'exprimer. On sent qu'il y a de l'effort au niveau de l'enregistrement et du mix qui sont assez clairs dans l'ensemble. Tu attaches de l'importance à inclure des messages sociétaux dans ta musique et c'est tout à ton honneur. Cependant selon nous il faudrait que tu ailles un peu plus en profondeur ou que tu adopte un angle d'écriture moins convenu pour avoir plus d'impact car il est facile de tomber dans des banalités avec ce genre de thématique (je pense à "cette société de consommation nous pousse à l'excès" par exemple). La musicalité du refrain chanté est très appréciable. Il serait bien que tu essaies d'en diluer plus dans tes couplets, car ton flow est souvent linéaire et une certaine lassitude peut s'installer sur le long terme. Pour conclure le morceau réunis plusieurs bons éléments, on pense qu'il faudrait travailler ton discours plus en profondeur et t'amuser davantage avec ton flow pour réellement toucher ton public.
 
Bon courage pour la suite. 
L’équipe 7C,

L'univers urbain est un peu juste du moins pour ce morceau. 
Quelques petites imperfections sur le calage instrums / voix. 
Prenez les conseils d'un topliner pour vous accompagner dans votre projet.
Il y a du flow  bien présent. 
L équipe Lymu.net

Ecriture intéressante. Le morceau fonctionne bien, après le refrain est un peu trop chanté pour ce qu'on recherche en priorité. Côté flow on aimerait entendre un peu plus de dynamique. Sinon c'est prometteur, on va suivre les sorties à venir 💪

Salut, j'espère que tu vas bien !

Le titre est réussi, il y a un vrai travail dans le rythme et la mélodie, qui donnent une cohérence entre la prod et ton flow. On saisit clairement le message que tu souhaite passer à travers ton morceau.

As-tu pensé à un clip pour tes prochains morceaux ?

Pour gagner en visibilité, as-tu essayé de lancer des campagnes de marketing ? (Post en feed et Story insta avec redirection vers tes clips, ou campagnes de preroll sur Youtube bien ciblées par exemple).

En tous cas, on va suivre la suite de près !

Andy, Mind

Une chanson à la formule pop-synthétique un peu rétro et kitsch pour la sonorité des synthétiseurs et des percussions qui semblent tout droit sortis de la fin des années '80 ou du tout début des années '90. L'approche vocale féminine qui s'allie à son homologue masculin véhicule un refrain vitaminé avec un côté givré très sucré. Ce titre sent le printemps avant le temps, en espérant réveiller la marmotte en attendant!

La publication est programmée via la page Facebook le 15 février à midi sur Montréal. En attendant, voici les liens vers les playlists :
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLQQEx2JoJCJuyQLhuxOVFCatpit_IyWdJ

https://open.spotify.com/playlist/0DtZCoNGBAUFJYhmo5GPLY

https://deezer.page.link/ASsT4rUUWxkRVBb78

https://soundcloud.com/boulimiquedemusique/sets/electropop-folktronica-synth

Avant que je puisse vous dire quand vous serez ajouté dans notre rotation musicale régulière, j'aurais besoin des informations suivantes:
- Votre track (plus simple dans groover svp)
- Lien de votre page Facebook **PRO**  (Important, si vous ne l'avez déjà indiqué dans votre profil Groover) Si c'est déjà là c'est parfait. Avoir une page Facebook est un élément-clé de notre marketing pour vous faire connaître. Il doit s'agir une "Page" Facebook et non un compte personnel.
- Si vous avez une vidéo clip, fournir la vidéo clip également comme 2e fichier: Wetransfer ou service du genre à mtdallaire@notremedia.com

Nous effectuons des ajouts à toutes les 2 ou 3 semaines, mais pas avant la date de diffusion que vous avez indiquée dans Groover, donc assurez-vous que la date est bonne.

Lorsque votre chanson sera partagée, vous serez avisé.
Il y aura une publication Facebook dans laquelle vous serez identifié et lorsque l'on traite votre dossier Groover, nous vous aviserons également.

Merci pour la découverte. 

https://niky.ca ou avec l'application iHeartRadio
(ou sur notre page Facebook https://www.facebook.com/nikyradiointernational/ )

Les ardeurs, les fragrances, les velours qui grondent, c'est la marque de fabrique de la pop de Paupière, où le Coeur Monarque se déploie comme une joyeuse ode à la mélancolie. Tout est très abouti, notamment l'interprétation. La liberté irrigue la musique de Paupière, et c'est ce postulat volage et chic qu'il faut arroser tous les jours. Bravo pour ça.
J'ai hâte d'entendre l'album. à vite !

Variété Française x Pop x Electronique. Des idées, des mélodies - il y a de la matière. L'instrumentale est un peu fragile. Revoir le mix pour le remettre au devant de la scène, pour qu'on entende bien tous les éléments. Peut-être introduire des éléments plus perçants / agressifs pour couper la douceur du morceau (tous les sons sont assez doux / comme des frottements - même pour la voix). Il faut créer plus de contraste entre les éléments de morceau pour nous faire ressentir quelque chose. Il faut que nos oreilles aient un échange avec la musique plutôt que juste en être effleuré.  Un côté indie et des idées de mélodie donc la créativité est là, il faut juste revoir comment bien détourer et mettre en avant vos qualités.

Hey there, thanks for sending this through. It's not for me, just genre wise - I'm sure people will dig it.

If you're after feedback, I would only suggest that it feels like one guitar and the drummer is going for more 90s-style grunge rock (like Alice in Chains), and the vocals and the other guitar is more for like a 90s-style college rock (like Counting Crows / Live / Dave Matthews or similar). I would suggest picking one direction for each song as it feels like the instruments are competing a bit? Or maybe the drummer could just chill a bit? The bassist seems to be in the middle of it.

I wish you all the best with the release. Kurt
Authentic song and performance. Overall stylistically and genre-wise too Rock for us, I'm afraid. Best of luck with the release!
The track sounds like some 90s pop-rock hits, which usually ended up as soap opera tracks. I don't know if that is the intention, but it would direct the track to a more mature audience.

Hello Blaze Project, thank you for your track The other day.

This is a nice track, one which I'm sure will appeal to 'easy listening' style radio stations.

My style of music is more short, sharp, loud and catchy so we're not quite on the same wavelength here I'm afraid.

I think a generation older than myself would like this, I genuinely do recognise this as a good song, that many will like. Chris Rea, Phil Collins fans etc I'm sure will appreciate this.

I suppose it's tapping in to that niche market, that will be your challenge.

Not one for me on this occasion but I wish you all the very best for 2021.
''The other day'' is a powerful love song. It reminds me folk rock songs about loving someone. Great guitar, interesting voice.

Merci pour l'envoi de votre "Church" au Musicodrome. La description est fidèle à ce que vous annoncez, c'est déjà un bon point pour commencer. Ensuite, vous avez frappé à la bonne porte puisque c'est aussi ce que nous recherchons comme nouveauté ! 
Le morceau fonctionne, on est d'emblée dans l'univers du post-rock ! Pour les côtés "pop" et "métal", les frontières du moins, on les cherche un peu ;) On est allé fouiner sur votre Bandcamp, à part sur "Verdik" pour l'agitation, on est toutefois bien ancré dans le post-rock !

S'il fallait faire un petite remarque, il est dommage que le son paraisse un peu 'étouffé' au niveau de l'enregistrement (j'ai eu le même ressenti sur SoundCloud que sur Bandcamp).

Dimitri

Hello guys, thanks for sending the sound.

In other times, without covid and with instrumental music in a high wave around here, I would even indicate to a festival that there was a lot of instrumental music in my city.

big hug and thanks for sending the music!

Autómata, hello, and thank you for sending. 

There's some cool transitions and sounds here, some good blends of texture and ramps up of noise. Post-Rock is tricky, from the masters of Mogwei to harder, more prog metal stuff, there's a balance between taking a listener with you and jolting them... a mix of progression and shock. 

I'd say the biggest thing here is the mix. All the drums have a hard and gated attack, separating them from the instruments. They 'click' when they should drive, I want to imagine this as a live recording with all the amp bleed and agro it should have. 

Ideas and track pretty good, just falters a little in presentation.

As always, that could be down to taste, but I hope maybe helpful in some way
great layering of elements - but i think the second instrumental verse could offer a bit more to show development from the start of the track

ciao Diego,
grazie di avere condiviso la traccia.
sto ascoltando anche le altre cose che avete su Soundcloud che confermano l'impressione che mi ha lasciato Oceano, ed è che siete interessanti. i suoni e l'attitudine sono quelli delle band con cui sono cresciuto (non credo abbiate bisogno che vi dica che non sembreranno attualissimi all'ascoltatore medio) e del resto anche le collaborazioni parlano chiaro. la cosa che mi colpisce è l'uso della voce e dei testi in italiano calati in quel contesto: in questo riecheggiate un altro tipo di tradizione musicale e ci sento dei riferimenti per niente scontati in quell'ambiente sonoro, con un risultato che spesso è interessante. 
al momento non mi sento di parlare di collaborazioni (come con chiunque altro) perchè la situazione è veramente troppo imprevedibile, ma se quando le cose si saranno normalizzate volete mandarci altre cose da ascoltare o riprendere la conversazione vi dico fin d'ora volentieri.

un saluto,

Pietro

Bonjour Brzn,
L’équipe de Cul7ure tient tout d’abord à te remercier pour l'envoi de ton morceau et la confiance que tu portes à notre égard.
Après plusieurs écoutes attentives de ton morceau, on est en mesure de te faire un retour. Le morceau est très complet et solide, on sent que tu maîtrises ta voix et que tu tentes des approches intéressantes avec l’autotune. La prod colle parfaitement avec la topline et les thèmes que tu abordes, ce qui résulte d’un ensemble cohérent.  
Le clip, bien que “classique”, n’en reste pas moins efficace et permet d’illustrer ta musique comme il se doit, ce qui est toujours une plus-value pour l’auditeur. Pour conclure, ton morceau assemble différents critères qui nous prouve ta maîtrise et ta créativité. En tout cas, nous sommes impatients de découvrir la suite de ton travail et de suivre ton évolution ! 

Bon courage pour la suite.

L’équipe 7C.

Salut,

La prod est douce, mélancolique, chill, calme. Lyricalement, c'est assez conscient, introspectif, émotionnel. Les flows sont plutôt bien maîtrisés, même si ça manque de "convictions", d'intonations pour rendre le morceau encore plus vivant. Le refrain est bien, l'autotune apporte un peu plus de profondeur, là ou les couplets restent plus "basique" à ce niveau. Visuellement, on est en cohérence, avec la mélancolie, les couleurs nocturnes, la solitude etc... Force pour la suite.

Cordialement,

Bonjour, il y a une base très solide bravo ! Le refrain est magnifique, ta voix est très juste, très belle. Il y a un univers musicale qui se dégage très bien de l'ensemble. Ton flow est très bon, j'aurai aimé que le texte soit un peu plus original pour que je sois comblé. Le cahier des charges est remplis mais tu pourrais largement sortir ton épingle du jeu en dégageant quelque chose de plus.

Les bases sont là, on est proche de quelque chose de top
J'ai hâte de découvrir la suite 

A bientôt j'espère

Gaëtan

Bonsoir et merci pour ce nouveau partage

Hi guys. Firstly thank you for letting me hear your music. I really appreciate it.
Reggae (well dub actually) with an underlying hint of The Specials in there for good measure hey? 
Let's deal with the mixing and engineering as a starter. Absolutely spot on. Captures the essence of the track perfectly. Cannot fault it.
The track itself is nice - but that's about it. It's not really a full dub mix and the reggae purist will tell you it's lacking something. You're kind of falling in between everything really which as you probably understand nowadays doesn't do you any favours.
It's definitely inoffensive though. Nobody's turning it off if it came on the radio. It just doesn't stand out.
From a radio point of view (my background) it's not the sort of track I would add to the general playlist, but I would pass it on to specialist shows and let them decide. Keep sending the track to as many reggae shows as you can. I also do a Ska show and I get sent a lot of dub, reggae, new-tone etc and there's quite of this coming through right now. Jamaican based music is coming in a rush...... you heard it here first!!!
All in all I'd like to keep tabs on your music to see how it progresses and develops. If you throw some horns in there and pick up the beat a little then you will have my attention!!!
I do wish you all the best with it and hope it brings you every success. Cheers, Beefy.

Nice! I like the vocal performance! It suits the energy of the song! I like the vocal timbre! I think the vocal lacks clarity. 
The instrumental sounds great! The groove of the instrumental is very nice. The drums sound great! The tightness of the drums works very well. 
Regarding mixing, your mix sounds very dynamic. However, the overall mix sounds messy. Try to balance out the different elements more efficiently. 
The structure works well and contains a clear and memorable chorus. 
All in all, a great tune! Make sure to work on the vocal. 

Best wishes,
PAN FM

Y a des intonations qui font vivre le morceau, mais je trouve qu'il manque de profondeur, de relief à mon sens. Peut-être le côté "One shot", était l'idée que tu voulais lui donner. Force pour la suite.

Cordialement,

Hi dastraa, thanks for sending us your music! "The Old Gods" offers a very accessible and smooth sound, the melodic arrangements are very dreamy and transporting, they build a nice soft enigmatic ambiance that contrasts well with the high-energy level,  very well-produced and easy on the ear, it is a good production overall, however, I'm sorry for passing but it sadly didn't hook us quite enough for a feature, sorry. Best of luck with your submissions and have a great day.

Hi, dastraa,

Great intro! 
The instrumental suits the vibe a lot! Great work on designing the various sounds. The groove of the instrumental is very nice. Try to create a clear top-line. 
Regarding mixing, you do a good job of creating a clean mix. You do a good job of creating an interesting stereo image. 
The structure is very unique. However, it is difficult to follow the structure. Make sure to define clear sections. 
All in all, a great track! Make sure to work on the instrumental. 

Kind regards,
Tap Water

alut ! 

Merci pour le partage. C'est dommage de ne pas m'avoir envoyé un vrai clip, en tant que réalisateur c'est surtout sur cette partie là que je peux apporter un oeil critique ou du moins une réelle expertise. 

Avant tout, petit point que tu pourrais améliorer : la descriptio. Elle est beaucoup trop chargé ça ne donne pas forcément envie de lire, hésite pas à structurer je pense que certains ne prennent pas le temps et c'est dommage car elle est importante quand on voit ton parcours ! 

Pour ce qui est du morceau malheureusement je ne suis pas très sensible à ce genre de sonorité en ce moment. Gros travail d'écriture qui est important à souligner et respect pour ça. Mais là actuellement je n'ai rien à te proposer pour plus de visibilité ou autres, je suis navré ! N'hésite pas à me faire suivre un clip si jamais, ça me parlera davantage !

Salut ! Ravi que vous me partagez votre son et votre profil ! 

Pour commencer, je suis super investit sur GROOVER, donc dès que je reçois un son, je cherche à connaître vraiment l’univers complet de l’artiste. Donc je lis vos informations, votre profil, je vais écouter ce que vous faites déjà etc… Pour avoir un vrai avis construit, cohérent et structurer, c’est ce que j’ai fait ;)

Je m’intéresse vraiment à la musique, à tout ce qui se fait dans le Game, donc déjà ce qui est sur, je note ton Blaz et je vais continuer à te suivre.

En ce qui concerne le son que je viens de découvrir, voici mon avis personnelle.

Le texte est vraiment travaillé, ça marque, ça fait vraiment plaisir, ça sort du lot ! J'aurais juste vu, un refrain peut-être plus "REFRAIN", je sais pas si tu voit ce que je veut dire, histoire de bien structurer le son !

C'est pas mal. Quelque détails encore à rêgler.

J'ai apprécié ta technique d'écriture pleine d'images fortes. Vibes interessantes. Les couleurs et les textures s'enchaines bien. Excellant travail de mix / master. 

J'ai trouvé quelque point faibles par ci par là

Flow pas terrible. J'aurais travaillé l'instru différement. Thème trop souvent abordé de cette manière. Je pense que tu devrais penser à clipper tes morceaux. C'est ce que les auditeurs aiment le plus. J'aurais souhaité que tu fasse preuve de plus d'innovation. 

J'espère que ces remarque te seront utiles. a+

Hello! Thank you so much for sharing this amazing track! Congratulations on the amazing composition! Count on our support.

Hello, Rock A La Carte! 
We loved your sound, but our focus is on electronic music. We did this short review for you, best regards!

A great tune that starts with a positive, friendly approach both melodically and lyrically. 
The guitar solo and choir reach the peak, making this piece so enjoyable. 
The folk sound with catchy choruses turns this record into a good one to play everywhere, anytime.

Hello Rock A La Carte, thank you for the track So much better (together).

There is no doubting the pop sensibility of this track nor it's catchiness.

For my personal preference in music it's way more pure pop than what I would ever listen to though.  I feel this may appeal to daytime radio fans who perhaps favour clean cut country music.  I actually feel this would do really well soundtracking a childrens TV show of some kind.

I love the energy and passion and I commend the fund raising, but not one for me I'm afraid.

All the best for 2021.

'So Much Better' is a fun project and also great to see these guys helping out a charity.
Unfortunately not quite a fit with our station, but we do wish you the best of luck with the song.
p.s Yes, awesome guitar solo indeed!

Hi, thanks for submitting your song to us!

In terms of production quality, we must say the song is not as we all expect, it is not masterized in the best way, BUT we felt an incredibily and inexplicable joy listening to it. This song is full of happines and causes a really uplifting feeling on people. Congratulations!

Hello merci pour le message.

- il est important de mettre une bio courte sur groover, écrite en FR et Anglais.

- il est important d’indiquer un max de liens réseaux sociaux + toutes les plateformes de streaming. Là il manque deezer par exemple, leader en France.

- dans ton message tu peux mettre un lien d’écoute vers d’autres titres, un contact mail, un dossier google drive, un dossier de presse, tout ce que tu veux.

- YT permet de montrer une clip, ou au moins un visualizer (image animée qui tourne en boucle), ou une lyrics video, éviter les images fixes.

- dans ton txt de description YT, en 1er tu dois indiquer ton smartlink d'écoute vers toutes les plateformes de streaming

Electro x Pop x French Touch. Un beau mélange de mood. Un groove proprement exécuté. Une vocale intéressante qui rappelle un peu 'Besnine' (un autre artiste français). C'est pas désagréable, au contraire, mais pas super original, un peu trop convenu à mon goût, à part le petit pont à 2.20 qui annonce un truc sympa... pour retomber un peu à plat sur le refrain. Désolé, pas pour nous

Hi  Mehari :)

My name is Paige, from GNH Records. Thank you so much for submitting Fame to us to consider for our Apple Music + Spotify playlist, Futurepop. It's our home for  "cutting-edge pop acts who nimbly genre-blend with clever, subversive sound design, ultramodern hip-hop or pioneering alternative R&B." It has a rabid cult following which we're very proud of.

Here are the links to follow / share it:
- Spotify: urlgeni.us/spotify/NgzB 
- Apple Music: urlgeni.us/applemusic/7jUt 

I realise it's a valuable use of credits to do this here, so we've taken a very close listen to Fame and want to provide you this constructive feedback on your submission.
 
So Fame definitely left us feeling like a good time was had. It's got plenty of groove, it's dripping with strong 80s-pop inspired vocal performances reminding us of modern bands like HAIM who do this kind of throwback indiepop-synthpop well. You honestly have produced and performed one of the most polished examples of this we've been sent in a while, so congratulations! The breakdown in the 2nd minute leading to that final build up and chorus was great.

Ultimately, while it impressed us, it just didn't subvert the expectations away from "regular" commercially successful retropop/throwback synthpop/indiepop formula. This had disco groove vibes that definitely work but that isn't something we actively want on our playlist. For Futurepop, we're consciously trying to be a real point of difference, looking for singles that push themselves into a bolder niche, taking innovative risks with more synthetic sound design or atypical arrangements, while still being grounded by very strong pop fundamentals. When you play through the first few artists we've selected for the playlist, you'll hear what we mean. We try to elevate the playlist beyond systemic commercial R&B/pop. I think you will easily find some major success with playlists and blogs that do focus on this, though.   

One other thing I can offer you, is a bit of an industry connection. One of our managed artists is Spectoral (@spectoral on Instagram) who co-curates the playlist with us. In fact, it lives on his artist account. So while I can't offer you a placement on the playlist, if you're an artist who is interested in creating music for the bleeding-edge, an artist who is a music addict like us, who shares our tastes, and always aspires to keep tabs on the most current sounds, then I'd strongly encourage you to DM @spectoral - on Instagram. Introduce yourself to him and send him your link. Tell him you spoke to Paige on Groover. He's real nice, a well connected producer and curator from Australia who is a true passionate new music addict himself. He's also a committee member of a not-for-profit (free) organisation called Beat Collective (beatcollective.net) that is one of the biggest artist-producer communities in the world. So he meets a LOT of artists and it's very valuable to be connected. So even if that doesn't result in you getting added to a playlist, you should still get some good value out of at least talking to him, a like-minded artist who values building good industry connections.

Go for it! :)

Paige R
GNH

Je n'étais pas familier avec le travail de Mehari. Incontéstablement une belle découverte. Une pop légère mais supeperbement produite.

Dear Mehari,

Although "Fame" is a solid production, I felt a few things could have been a bit different; if I may :

a) I felt the vocals were way too loud in the mix. I would have really liked them a bit quieter !
b) Instrumental was on the other hand low in volume, especially in the verses. I would have tried to match the volume of the vocals and turn it down by 1 or 2 db !
c) Last but not least, I would have liked for more upfront drums, especially for a song of your genre !

I'm really sorry I will have to pass on "Fame" for now.
Can't but thank you for your submission and wish you all the success with it !

Hi Darwin, Mainecoon and Jae Joven :)

My name is Paige, from GNH Records. We're a boutique PR and A&R agency who manage a handful of artists, one of which is Spectoral. He's heavily involved and usually has final say on track adds, but we actually do the bulk of the curation on his behalf here on Soundplate, because Futurepop receives over 100 submissions a week at the moment! Curating this is a labour of love.

We co-curate Futurepop, our main playlist, for both Apple Music and Spotify. This is the one you submitted Your Body to. We look for a specific niche to feature. Futurepop's description reads: "Cutting-edge pop acts who nimbly genre-blend with clever, subversive sound design, ultramodern hip-hop or pioneering alt-RnB. It's the future of pop, pushing the genre forward."  

Here are the links to follow Futurepop on:
- Spotify: urlgeni.us/spotify/NgzB
- Apple Music: urlgeni.us/applemusic/7jUt

It's actually got quite a cult following of real artists and industry figures, who genuinely love Futurepop, and often return to stream it for inspiration, telling us it's "full of bangers they wish they'd written" and that's definitely our vision for the playlist, which is why we're so picky with its curation. Some of the most wildly popular artists on that playlist who are huge inspirations, have actually had their reps contact us to submit to Futurepop, which is the ultimate compliment.

Your Body is ridiculously catchy, and full of innovative production all over the place, which keeps it interesting. That flume-esque wonky bassline in the drop was great. The feature, by Jae, was on point, with great bars and a great flow. The darkness of the beat heavily reminded us of a track called U Talkin' To Me by Disco Montego (look them up) however, what made this different is that it refused to be a throwback, retro track at all. It effectively discarded the tropes that could've so easily pulled this into a dark discopop.80s synthwave vibe. The moment that sealed the deal for us, were the introduction of the rapid high synth sequence around 2:07. Love the track, honestly. We're very happy to say we've added you to the playlist, on both Apple Music, and Spotify. You made it look easy, but we actually have to turn away an enormous amount of music, plus, we never have over 50 tracks on the playlist. We're extremely selective, and you're among some serious A-list peers.

Here's a couple of things to note about being added:

Futurepop is a passion project. We're consciously keeping it fresh, keeping it one of the most AAA quality playlists known in the industry; only 40-50 tracks max. We hunt for artists that push themselves into a bolder niche, taking innovative risks with more synthetic sound design, atypical arrangements, informed by hip-hop and pioneering alternative R&B, while still being grounded by very strong pop fundamentals. This makes the playlist a magnet for aspiring artists, who return to stream it regularly for inspiration. You'll hear what we mean if you play through a few of the artists we're currently featuring. We try to elevate the playlist beyond systemic commercial R&B/pop. I'd definitely encourage you to follow it if this is your jam. One tip: if you can get your fanbase streaming Futurepop while you're on it, we have found it has an incredible impact on populating your "Fans Also Like" section.

One other thing I can offer you, is an industry connection. One of our managed artists is Spectoral (@spectoral on Instagram) who co-curates the playlist with us. In fact, we put the playlist on his artist account. Now that you're part of the Futurepop club, I really recommend you capitalise on this and connect! If you're an artist who is interested in creating music for the bleeding-edge, an artist who is a music addict like us, who shares our tastes, and always aspires to keep tabs on the most current sounds, then I'd strongly encourage you to DM @spectoral - on Instagram. Introduce yourself to him and tell him you were added by Paige. He's real nice, a well connected producer and curator from Australia who is a true passionate new music addict himself. He's also a committee member of a not-for-profit (free) organisation called Beat Collective (beatcollective.net) that is one of the biggest artist-producer communities in the world. So he meets a LOT of artists and it's very valuable to be connected. You should get some good value out of talking to him and letting him know you've joined the Futurepop ranks. You seem like like-minded artists who value building good industry connections.

Go for it! :)

Paige
GNH Records

Dear Sergio Alejandro,

First of all I really liked the fact that you had the English subs in the video !!! Very clever move !

Although "Pensando En Ti" is a very solid production, there were a couple of things that I would have liked differently; if I may :

a) At 1:38 I was really expecting the kick and snare to have being introduced !
b) Drums were a bit in the back in the mix. Also, I would have really liked for a way bigger low end, especially for a song of your genre ! When I compared your songs against similar songs in my playlists, the difference was more obvious than I would like for my listeners.
(One great trick here is to compare your mix against the great ones, and notice how the drums sound on different sound systems !)

Not a bad song at all, but unfortunately at this level the smallest differences can have the greatest impacts.

I'm really sorry I will have to pass on this gem for now Sergio Alejandro.

Can't but thank you for your submission and wish you all the success in 2021 !

Hi!

"Shine Like Me" sounds like a modern version of 2000's R&B, reminded me a lot of Timbaland's old productions, which I like a lot. Lyna's voice absolutely blew my mind!

With this beautiful voice, those great lyrics and this awesome beat, I felt like I was listening to a brand new Aaliyah song, it really got into my heart very quickly, I just couldn't stop listening to it over and over again, really, this song is a bomb!

The production is just flawless, all elements are very well distributed in the mix and all of them also were wisely chosen, congratulations on that!

This is a very strong composition, the production mixes old styles with new sounds and it showcases beautifully the huge talent of Lyna. I see a huge potential on it and hope to hear more from you soon!

I'll be happy to share "Shine Like Me" with my team and on our Twitter, as well as add it on our Spotify playlist!

Thanks for sending the track, be safe and keep on!

Thank you for submitting “Let Me Wild” to me. I always appreciate the opportunity to hear new tracks by talented musicians. I particularly love the 80s flavor of this one. However, I’m currently after 60s/early 70s sounds to add to my playlist. Again, thank you so very much for submitting this track to me. If I do come across another playlister looking for classic 80s rock sounds, then I will be sure to pass along your band’s name with a link to your Spotify.

Hello! Thank you so much for sharing this great track! I really like the way it combines some elements of syntpop with rock riffs, creating a very unique and authentic retrofuturistic atmosphere. At the same time, elements of hard / prog rock are very clear and I really like this combination. There are a lot of bands with The Struts using this theme and sound to create a new classic and I think this is quite authentic. The vocals are also very pleasing to me. Honorable mention for the guitar solo which is very well built, well-designed and executed. Congratulations on the excellent work! Count on us.

Hello! Thanks to send me your track. I really liked the 80's vibe! The beybords and the riffs are insane! The chorus is a plus of course. The metric and the mix of the elements are insane too. Again, thanks to send me your track and cheers from Brazil!

Hi, Franck Dansaert,

Great atmosphere! 
The instrumental suits the vibe a lot! The arrangement has a great variety of elements. 
In terms of mixing, you manage to create a lot of dynamic. You manage to create a nice stereo image. The instrumental is not balanced out well enough. The various elements could be adjusted differently. 
The structure is unique. It is easy to follow the structure. 
All in all, a great tune! Make sure to work on the mix. 

Kind regards,
Tap Water

Hi Franck,

This is a very beautiful track! I love this composition! I just wish I had a channel where I could promote your music.

Let me explain... We accept many genres, but (as you can see in our profile) we are looking for music that falls in the category of Christian music. We are a Christian publisher and we promote Christian music / Christian artists to our audience. Key in all the songs / music that we promote is that it is focussed on God / the gospel of Jesus Christ / a Christian way of living.

I know that your work is instrumental... but nothing in the titles of your song or discography gives a Christian label / flavor to your work. If I somehow got it wrong, then please let me know and help me understand how your music is Christian.

I do believe that your music deserves a much larger audience than you currently have. As I said in the beginning of my response... I just don't have the channel / audience to support you with this.

I wish you all the best with finding new channels to reach more listeners.

Hi Franck! Thanks for sharing your music with us. Unfortunately, Effervescence isn't a good fit for our "Calm Music + Nature Sounds" playlist, as we're looking for chill tracks that feature nature sounds. Thanks again for sharing. Stay safe, and best of luck!

Thanks for your submission. We listened to your track carefully this morning. Indeed it's well composed and arranged (theme, instruments etc) BUT the mix could be enhance if you use more of good reverbs and compressor so as to "glue" all instruments together. Use panning as well. Especially strings lack of reverb in the first part of the track, and ideally the arpeggio shouldn't not make the string pattern sounds too repetitive (fix the velocity, try too make it sounds more "natural", not programmed strings). It's not easy to make samples sounds real and natural the play one's play it but it's important in order to make your track sounding best, not "out of the box" (samples). All the best

Hi Frank, thanks for sending us your track.
It is a fantastic composition and very unusual these days.
It makes us very happy to discover orchestral composers, since in general the classical music promotion  is difficult for pianists and guitarists (our specialty), it is even more complex for orchestral music.

For this reason we don't have a playlist focused on this genre of classical music. However, we will share your piece "Effervescence" in one of our new growing playlists and our social media.

We wish you the best and hope to soon have an audience for orchestral music and soundtracks.

Best regards.

Sofía
Caoba Records

Bonjour et merci de votre envoi . Dans le genre le titre est bien chanté et globalement bien construit. Dans cette approche variétés je trouve que les choix de productions (Cocottes de guitares et effets) sont un peu datés et pourraient être modernisés. Globalement l'ensemble est bien fait mais manque d'une personnalité artistique singulière qui entrerait mieux en cohérence avec nos choix éditoriaux. 
L'autre souci dans ce type de chanson est qu'elles accèdent à leur audience par de forts investissement marketing ....

J'aime beaucoup l'ambiance et les sonorités du titre, et je trouve que le fait de chanter en français est un gros plus sur ce projet. Le clip arrive un peu tard pour nous car on ne traite dans notre sélection dominicale que les clips sortis lors de la semaine en cours, mais on va suivre la suite de l'aventure avec intérêt.

Bonjour Trip for Léon,

Hi Trip for Leon :)

My name is Paige, from GNH Records. Thank you so much for submitting Swallow to us to consider for our Apple Music + Spotify playlist, Futurepop. It's our home for  "cutting-edge pop acts who nimbly genre-blend with clever, subversive sound design, ultramodern hip-hop or pioneering alternative R&B." It has a rabid cult following which we're very proud of.

Here are the links to follow / share it:
- Spotify: urlgeni.us/spotify/NgzB 
- Apple Music: urlgeni.us/applemusic/7jUt 

I realise it's a valuable use of credits to do this here, so we've taken a very close listen to Swallow and want to provide you this constructive feedback on your submission.
 
Haunting and etheral are two words that quickly came to mind here. You've got a very atmospheric vocal delivery, the vocal performance here was absolutely lovely to listen to and holds our attention around those reversed-synth countermelodic notes. The little high bells and choice of chords (chromatic) definitely gives this whole track an unsettling, Phantom Of The Opera feel, but with a nice modern twist.

Ultimately, while it impressed us, I can't really confidently call this a strong pop song. This is very avant garde, for sure. It flirts with the pop genre but it's definitely something more artistic and abrasive. For Futurepop, we're consciously trying to be a real point of difference, looking for singles that push themselves into a bolder niche, taking innovative risks with more synthetic sound design or atypical arrangements, while still being grounded by very strong pop fundamentals. When you play through the first few artists we've selected for the playlist, you'll hear what we mean. We try to elevate the playlist beyond systemic commercial R&B/pop. I think you will easily find some major success with playlists and blogs that do focus on avant garde, or potentially art pop, though.   

One other thing I can offer you, is a bit of an industry connection. One of our managed artists is Spectoral (@spectoral on Instagram) who co-curates the playlist with us. In fact, it lives on his artist account. So while I can't offer you a placement on the playlist, if you're an artist who is interested in creating music for the bleeding-edge, an artist who is a music addict like us, who shares our tastes, and always aspires to keep tabs on the most current sounds, then I'd strongly encourage you to DM @spectoral - on Instagram. Introduce yourself to him and send him your link. Tell him you spoke to Paige on Groover. He's real nice, a well connected producer and curator from Australia who is a true passionate new music addict himself. He's also a committee member of a not-for-profit (free) organisation called Beat Collective (beatcollective.net) that is one of the biggest artist-producer communities in the world. So he meets a LOT of artists and it's very valuable to be connected. So even if that doesn't result in you getting added to a playlist, you should still get some good value out of at least talking to him, a like-minded artist who values building good industry connections.

Go for it! :)

Paige R
GNH

Bonjour Amyna, merci d’avoir choisi Cul7ure pour l’écoute de ton son. Pour commencer, nous soulignerons la qualité vocale qui cache un très bon potentiel. On te conseillera de faire attention au mixage du son pour tes futurs projets. La voix est peut-être trop faible par rapport à la prod, ce qui est dommage quand le potentiel est présent. Attention, rien de grave, mais le but est de vous voir grandir. Le son est joli et réussi.

Pour la suite, il sera intéressant de proposer un clip afin d’apporter un plus au niveau de ta visibilité. Il ne faut pas non plus te précipiter car beaucoup d’artistes proposent de bons clips sans pour autant avoir un son d’une qualité semblable. Opère par étape et tout ira bien. Tu as un potentiel à exploiter, nous espérons donc que tu continueras sur cette voie.

Avant que je puisse vous dire quand vous serez ajouté dans notre rotation musicale régulière, j'aurais besoin des informations suivantes:
- Votre track (plus simple dans groover svp)
- Lien de votre page Facebook **PRO**  (Important, si vous ne l'avez déjà indiqué dans votre profil Groover) Si c'est déjà là c'est parfait. Avoir une page Facebook est un élément-clé de notre marketing pour vous faire connaître. Il doit s'agir une "Page" Facebook et non un compte personnel.
- Si vous avez une vidéo clip, fournir la vidéo clip également comme 2e fichier: Wetransfer ou service du genre à mtdallaire@notremedia.com

Nous effectuons des ajouts à toutes les 2 ou 3 semaines, mais pas avant la date de diffusion que vous avez indiquée dans Groover, donc assurez-vous que la date est bonne.

Lorsque votre chanson sera partagée, vous serez avisé.
Il y aura une publication Facebook dans laquelle vous serez identifié et lorsque l'on traite votre dossier Groover, nous vous aviserons également.

Merci pour la découverte. 

https://niky.ca ou avec l'application iHeartRadio
(ou sur notre page Facebook https://www.facebook.com/nikyradiointernational/ )

Amazing Track, I would love to include in station playlist and add to General Rotation for Broadcast

Pop x Experimental. A bit too far fetched for me. The vocal and main synth sounds can step back to let the other elements talk (the drum kit, nintendo sound). Much is going on in the high frequencies, not much in the low ones. It's missing a little something for us to travel when we hear the song. If we click throughout the song we feel the same way, hear the same elements. You want us to feel different emotions throughout it. If we have discovered the entirety of the song in just 1min then we will not want to hear more. The song must evolve, up/down - come/go... It seems more it is continuing, but to which end?
Hey Russell, thanks so much for sending through your new track. A great fusion of genres going on here. Unfortunately it's not quite right for my show so I won't be supporting I'm afraid.

Experimental electronic and dance pop sounds. Fantastic groove and soaring higher vocals makes a dreamy atmosphere. Something to remember as La Roux or Florence and the machine on trips. We appreciate it 
We will share the track in 'our Music Feed' playlist.

J'aime assez l'ambiance qui se dégage du titre et son atmosphère. Attention parfois à ce qu'elle ne devienne pas trop confuse et à ce que les différents arrangements servent vraiment le morceau. L'ensemble a du potentiel en tout cas!

L'ambiance est mystérieuse et fait pas mal voyager et le clip lui correspond bien.

Le master manque un peu de dynamique, les respirations apportant souvent plus de panache aux moments forts. 

L'accent français est également très présent, ce qui peut rebuter bon nombre de professionnels (par expérience c'est souvent l'élément radical qui fait qu'un morceau n'est pas choisi). 

J'espère que ces remarques vous apporteront quelque chose et vous souhaite une excellente continuation ! 
Antoine
J'aime bien le côté onirique, berceuse mais j'ai trouvé que la performance vocale n'avait pas spécialement un effet sur moi, notamment à cause du flow et de la mélodie. Désolé :(

Delicate production & ethereal vocals lead the listener into Trip for Leon's "Swallow". The production builds the tension nicely as the electronica builds into a trip-hoppy sound. The combination of classically trained and crunching bass-lines works very well in my opinion, especially when set to the glitchy ink-spot style visuals. A track suitable for mainstream and niche radio shows. I'm looking forward to hearing more!
Soothing voice for sure but track is a little too mellow for me. Just a matter of personal preference. Thank you for sharing.

Bonjour Trip for Leon,

Merci pour votre proposition de titre,
bien réalisé mais pas adapté à notre programmation DEEP ELECTRO POP DANCE.
Vos sonorités sont un peu trop pop rock pour pouvoir être diffuser chez nous.

Je vous souhaite un vif succès avec ce nouveau projet par ailleurs,

Olivier

Bonjour Trip for Léon, merci de nous avoir envoyé votre musique! "Swallow" offre un son très deep, dark et immersif, vous livrez un vocal très stylé qui est angélique et envoutant, les arrangements mélodiques bâtissent une ambiance bien sinistre et énigmatique avec un côté très "raw", c'est une bonne production overall, cependant, elle ne nous a malheureusement pas assez accrochés pour une publication sur notre blogue, désolé. L'équipe EKM.CO vous souhaite la meilleur des chances avec vos soumissions et bonne continuation.

Salut Trip for Léon, 
Merci pour l'envoi de votre morceau, il est super mais ne rentre pas tout à fait dans notre ligne. On passe notre tour cette fois-ci.
Bonne continuation

De toute façon, félicitations pour votre travail ! Je vous souhaite beaucoup de succès !

Même si nous restons à l'écoute de toute l’actualité musicale, notre ligne éditoriale est résolument rock franco. Voici un exemple des artistes que nous défendons : Stupéflip, La Pietà, Therapie Taxi, Les Hôtesses d’Hilaire, Radio Elvis, Feu! Chatterton, Süeür… 
Bonne continuation à vous.

Hello merci pour le message.

- il est important de mettre une bio sur groover, courte, indiquant ta ville d’origine, écrite en FR ou FR d’abord puis Anglais.

- il est important d’indiquer un max de liens réseaux sociaux + toutes les plateformes de streaming, là il mank deezer, pourtant tjs numéro 1 en France.

- dans ton message tu peux mettre un lien d’écoute vers d’autres titres, un contact mail, un dossier google drive comme tu l'as fait, tout ce que tu veux.

- dans ton message tu peux exprimer des besoins précis : diffusion du titre, recherche de concerts, recherche d’entourage professionnel spécifique (mgmt, label, distribution etc….)

- YT est une plateforme virale car ça permet de montrer une clip, ou au moins un visualizer (image animée qui tourne en boucle), ou une lyrics video, donc je déconseille les images fixes, surtout pour un pitch groover.

- je trouve le son très bon, musique et voix, bravo.

- je trouve le nom du projet pas très accrocheur, et je pense pas etre le 1er à oser te le dire

- tu es clipeur aussi ? ton DP dit ''vidéo director''. Ca peut m'intéresser...

j'ai une agence artists & labels services, ça nous arrive de proposer des clippeurs à nos artistes... hésite pas à m'envoyer un mail

guillaume
www.lepoolagency.com
I felt the song could have hit a bit harder overall. keep it up though <3

Bonjour Hugo,

Bonjour et merci de votre envoi . C'est plutôt bien écrit sur une composition et une instrumentation de facture très classique. Cela semble fonctionner en live mais il est difficile de restituer cela dans un enregistrement. Donc pour moi en l'état nous sommes sur une maquette live, pas encore sur une véritable production phono. L'étape suivante est peut être de réfléchir à comment orchestrer cela de manière à mettre au mieux le propos en avant y compris dans la dimension humoristique .

Bonjour Hugo
merci pour le partage du morceau et d'avoir pris le temps de lire ma présentation ;-)

Personnellement j'aime bien les morceaux "brut" guitare/voix comme ceux écouté.
Le fait qu'ils soient en live c'est chouette parce-que l'on perçoit bien le rapport au public.

Il y a à mon goût un petit travail de justesse à faire au niveau de la voix et de la respiration.
Sinon il y a des réseaux à explorer avec le répertoire chanson française que tu proposes (prix Georges Moustaki, Sacem etc...)

Je ne prends malheureusement plus d'artistes en management mais il est possible de faire un rdv pour parler de ton projet sans problème.

Concernant ta demande précise:
* Si la chanson n'est pas trop référencée "Lyon" et fonctionne pour un public plus large. Oui bien sûr que ça fonctionne, c'est bien de revendiquer d'où l'on vient.
* Si cet arrangement simple guitare-voix suffit pour une exploitation ou si cela mériterait une version studio plus produite.
Tout dépend de l'exploitation que tu veux en faire. Pour du booking c'est bien, pour un EP il y a du travail en studio à prévoir.

Bonne continuation
Valérie
PS: et merci pour ta bonne humeur et ta sincérité tant dans les textes que dans les chansons et ta photo ;-)
Bonjour Hugo, Désolé, je n'ai pas accroché du tout au concept... ni la musique, ni les paroles, ni la voix... Peut etre que sur scène, c'est différent. Bonne continuation

Nous aimons le soin que vous apportez à l’instrumentalisation de votre titre, c’est un véritable atout. Nous vous souhaitons une bonne continuation et nous vous encourageons à poursuivre votre projet afin de nous faire écouter votre évolution.

Nous restons à votre disposition pour toutes questions et nous vous souhaitons une bonne journée. 

Cordialement,

Kofton Music.

hey there guys, thanks for sharing your music! This is a kickass alt rock tune with the electro elements mixed in. Reminds me of Linkin Park a bit when it comes to the overall sound. A bit more old-school rock maybe when we look at the melody progressions. Badass vocals, great dynamics. All in all, good song but it's not quite the vibe that I push in the playlists (I love LP but they're not featured either). keep up the genre-bending music, all the best for the single! - Ben // C22

Hey there! Massive sounding here! Very neat instrumental patterns that mix in great with the edgy vocals! But for now we're looking for a more commercial kind of rock track. Thanks so much for sharing! All the best!

Hi guys. Firstly thanks for sending me your music. I really appreciate it.
Electro-rock with dashes of rap and post-hardcore. Does it work? I actually think it kind of does. It is certainly different and it has a stadium anthem feel to it.
I have a couple of issues though. When singing in your second language, you really need to get the lyrics right, not just with the grammar, but with the pronunciation too. Because when you have a very lyric heavy track like this one all the little things add up.
I think this really stands up as it's really a bridge between electronic and hard-core rock. There's definitely not many acts around producing this type of sound. In my mind I start to think of Alice Cooper and Black Sabbath, bringing them into the 21st century. We're not really allowed to talk about these guys any more but Lostprophets are a decent example of where they were trying to go with their sound.
The production is first rate. Obviously there are so many levels you are playing with here and the balance is just right. I commend you on that!
This is definitely a contender to get onto the rock stations playlists. it has something about it that makes it stand out. I will definitely pass your links onto our programming manager and see what they want to do with the track.
I wish you all the success with the release and look forward to hearing more from you guys very soon. Cheers, Beefy
Morceau de conception très moderne. Malheureusement, je crains de ne pas faire partie du public cible réceptif à ce type de musique

Till We Die levitates somewhere between late-eighties nu-metal,  alternative rock, indie rock, and contemporary alt-metal. The song combines all these elements in such a distinctive composition, but these ingredients work together in harmony. Perhaps the easiest way to explain this song is to classify verse into a nu-metal/hip hop metal category, while the half-step choruses are leaning towards alt-metal/alt-rock. The group also incorporates a bit of electronic music along the way. However, these are mainly minimal but hearable accentuations that decorate specific partitions of the song. Till Will Die has a strong potential for commercial success because of the ear-appealing choruses that are remaining memorable. Good job!

Hi Maevane :)

My name is Paige, from GNH Records. Thank you so much for submitting La Mome to us to consider for our Apple Music + Spotify playlist, Futurepop. It's our home for  "cutting-edge pop acts who nimbly genre-blend with clever, subversive sound design, ultramodern hip-hop or pioneering alternative R&B." It has a rabid cult following which we're very proud of.

Here are the links to follow / share it:
- Spotify: urlgeni.us/spotify/NgzB 
- Apple Music: urlgeni.us/applemusic/7jUt 

I realise it's a valuable use of credits to do this here, so we've taken a very close listen to La Mome and want to provide you this constructive feedback on your submission.
 
While we do not speak French, we appreciated the beauty in this track. Your feminine, bedroom-vocal delivery was obviously remeniscent of acts like Lorde, Billie Eilish and so on, and the slowjam, chilled bedroom pop vibe was given an extra accent with those synth sweeps throughout the choruses. This seems to be a lyric-heavy singer-songwriter track that sounds like it's very personal and drawn from real-life experiences, it comes across effectively in both the piano-driven arrangement and your careful vocal emotion.

Ultimately, while it impressed us, this wasn't really that different from the regular bedroom pop female pop formula in a way that makes it appropriate for our playlist. For Futurepop, we're consciously trying to be a real point of difference, looking for singles that push themselves into a bolder niche, taking innovative risks with more synthetic sound design or atypical arrangements, while still being grounded by very strong pop fundamentals. When you play through the first few artists we've selected for the playlist, you'll hear what we mean. We try to elevate the playlist beyond systemic commercial R&B/pop. I think you will easily find some major success with playlists and blogs that do focus on this, though.   

One other thing I can offer you, is a bit of an industry connection. One of our managed artists is Spectoral (@spectoral on Instagram) who co-curates the playlist with us. In fact, it lives on his artist account. So while I can't offer you a placement on the playlist, if you're an artist who is interested in creating music for the bleeding-edge, an artist who is a music addict like us, who shares our tastes, and always aspires to keep tabs on the most current sounds, then I'd strongly encourage you to DM @spectoral - on Instagram. Introduce yourself to him and send him your link. Tell him you spoke to Paige on Groover. He's real nice, a well connected producer and curator from Australia who is a true passionate new music addict himself. He's also a committee member of a not-for-profit (free) organisation called Beat Collective (beatcollective.net) that is one of the biggest artist-producer communities in the world. So he meets a LOT of artists and it's very valuable to be connected. So even if that doesn't result in you getting added to a playlist, you should still get some good value out of at least talking to him, a like-minded artist who values building good industry connections.

Go for it! :)

Paige R
GNH

What an unusual track. The writer obviously has a sense of humour that permeates the song. Quirky, comedic lyrics combine with a persistent rock beat as a music bed. The music video is most entertaining with its numerous pop culture icons and symbolic references. A genuine 'novelty' number.

This record is so cheesy but at the same time it has a fantastic tongue in cheek feel with a great sense of humour. Some great classic rock sensibilities too. Saying that the lyrics are really catchy and there genuinely is a market for records like this

Hello Almost Red, thank you for your track Electric Car.

This song is quite unusual but also quite fun, 10/10 for originality!

Most songs with spoken word style vocals tend to be slow ballad type songs but not so here.

This feels like a throwback song that could have been big in the late 80's early 90's perhaps.  As it stands it's not a good match for me personally, just not to my tastes ultimately.

I do wish you all the best for 2021, keep being you.

Une chanson française aux teintes blues-rock qui frappe fort sur une multitude d'industries qui nous vendent du rêve et l'illusion de plus en plus déconnecté de la réalité. Le clip illustre de manière fort éloquente cette manipulation de masse pour faire toujours plus de fric par ces compagnies psychopathes qui n'adhèrent vraisemblablement à aucune valeur à part leur celui qu'affiche leur bilan financier de fin d'Année.

Bonjour, très bonne pièce.

Nous sommes une station de radio/télévision commerciale internationale du Québec, Canada. Affiliée iHeartRadio.
Nous mettons l'emphase sur les artistes émergents canadiens pour les rotations musicales.

Toutefois, nous avons une émission de découvertes internationales et nous allons faire jouer votre pièce. 
L'émission s'intitule "120 minutes autour du monde" et est de 11h am à 13h, heure du Québec, du lundi au vendredi.
Votre chanson va apparaître une fois lors de la présentation découverte de la semaine, ensuite elle va rejouer au
hasard des autres épisodes futurs.

Avant que je puisse vous dire quand vous serez diffusé, j'aurais besoin des informations suivantes:
- Votre track (plus simple dans groover svp)
- Lien de votre page Facebook **PRO**  (Important, si vous ne l'avez déjà indiqué dans votre profil Groover) Si c'est déjà là c'est parfait. Avoir une page Facebook est un élément-clé de notre marketing pour vous faire connaître. Il doit s'agir une "Page" Facebook et non un compte personnel.
- Si vous avez une vidéo clip, fournir la vidéo clip également comme 2e fichier: Wetransfer ou service du genre à mtdallaire@notremedia.com

Vous devriez passer à notre émission "120 minutes autour du monde" dans les 30 jours suivant la réception de toutes vos informations, mais pas avant la date de diffusion que vous avez indiquée dans Groover, donc assurez-vous que la date est bonne.

Lorsque votre chanson sera partagée, vous serez avisé.
Il y aura une publication Facebook dans laquelle vous serez identifié et lorsque l'on traite votre dossier Groover, nous vous aviserons également.
Vous serez avisé pour le passage à l'épisode des découvertes, mais pas lors des autres épisodes.
Une plateforme sera bientôt disponible pour vous permettre d'auto-créer votre entrevue et présentation qui sera diffusée.

Merci pour la découverte. 

https://niky.ca ou avec l'application iHeartRadio
(ou sur notre page Facebook https://www.facebook.com/nikyradiointernational/ )

Une chanson pop-synthétique aux influences musicales bigarrées. I like your general vocals and ideas a lot here, they are very pleasing to hear. The composition and general vocals, songwriting are well done but I feel like the processing of your vocals and its technical front need to be checked on, Keep it up!

Hey Naftali, thanks for the submission. So I didn't hear any incorporation of reggae vibes in your new track 'waves of faith' for starters. Your track has much work that needs done in the progression department, meaning the flow of the track wasn't as smooth as it could be. Much of this stems from your vocals such as when you try to put a lot out in the hooks and your pace begins to out weighs the melody in speed. Synchronicity is key, it's so important to match the tempo tie between vocals and melody. Also the video didn't make much sense, it did more harm than good for your track. The parts of the vocalist singing were inspirational but the man in the woods almost seemed comedic at times. For a production that was supposed to bare meaning, the man in the woods 'struggling to survive' whom had a civilization literally right next door, took away from the meaning. The acting in and of itself was lack luster. Overall decent production quality song wise but there is much work that needs to be done. Hope this helps, keep on fighting to be heard! -Affinity Ascension

Hello Ruan,

Nous ne publions aucun retour sur les singles sans clip vidéo sans quoi nous serions complètement submergé. 
Je vous encourage a lire la fiche de présentation des partenaires professionnels que vous contactez !
Et aussi de signer personnellement vos messages, c'est toujours mieux de construire une relation avec un message personnalisé et bien attitré.

Pour vous faire un court retour sur votre musique, la composition est top, rien à redire, en revanche la production manque complètement de modernité. Le mix manque clairement d'espace, les instruments sonnent trop "inda face" Alors que la voix tend à s'envoler et à prendre de l'ampleur.. Très clairement il faut travailler des reverb et des delay pour donner plus d'ampleur, tout comme le ferait London Grammar et Lana Del Rey justement !

J'ai fais un tour sur votre instagram aussi, et il faut clairement intensifier votre présence sur les réseaux. Même sans release officielle, vous pouvez largement trouver moyen d'être plus présent et d'approfondir votre univers, il serait bien dommage de sortir un titre sans tribune et public !

Le projet est prometteur, donc percevrez et soignez vos détails !

Remy & La Pulpe Club

Ciao Pierfrancesco, grazie per aver condiviso con noi la tua “L’Anima del vento” e di conseguenza per averci fatto conoscere il tuo progetto. Siamo lietissimi di condividere sulla nostra pagina FB e sulla nostra playlist di Spotify il tuo singolo. Tra poco ti invieremo i link e ti ritroverai anche taggato :D
Da un punto di vista artistico siamo affascinati dal tuo stile e dallo spirito del tuo progetto che definiremmo Cantautoriale con la C maiuscola non a caso, ovvero capace di riallacciarsi ad una tradizione pregiata, “alta”, per così dire. Complimenti!
Da un punto di vista più tecnico produttivo, l’onestà ci obbliga ad esprimerti il nostro pensiero con la stessa sincerità, considerandolo anche un dovere nei tuoi confronti avendoci tu segnalato il tuo materiale anche allo scopo di ottenere un feedback! Il sound ci è sembrato un po’ strano soprattutto per quanto riguarda la voce. Questa sembra a nostro avviso un po’ troppo scura, scollata dal mix. In alcuni punti anche un po’ incostante dal punto di vista del focus, come ci fossero degli allontanamenti dal microfono. A nostro avviso la produzione andrebbe remixata (nel senso di RI-mixata)…perché è forse proprio in trattamenti audio più accorti che potresti trovare, ci permettiamo di dire, una svolta tecnico artistica che il tuo progetto sicuramente merita per intensità dei contenuti lirici e musicale ma anche per la confezione degli arrangiamenti, sicuramente interessante. Sperando di esserti stati di un qualche aiuto rimaniamo a disposizione anche su info@lotusmusic.it se mai ti dovesse servire una consulenza più approfondita e, per così dire, lavorativa! A tra poco con i link, grazie!

Ciao Pierfrancesco, 
ti parla Guido, A&R  di Grifo Dischi.

Ho avuto modo di ascoltare il tuo brano e, ad un primo ascolto, devo dirti che ho apprezzato molto la ricerca dell'arrangiamento e dell'orchestrazione; allo stesso modo ho trovato notevole lo sforzo compositivo. Ad ogni modo l'atmosfera dell'intro nel primo minuto del brano è preziosa e andrebbe tutelata.

Tuttavia nutro molte perplessità sull'utilizzo della voce, a partire proprio dalle caratteristiche timbriche.
 Sarebbe interessante se avessi delle composizioni squisitamente strumentali da sottoporci, per un'eventuale discorso editoriale.

Per il momento ti faccio un grosso in bocca al lupo,
a presto,

G.

Bonjour, très bonne pièce.

Nous sommes une station de radio/télévision commerciale internationale du Québec, Canada. Affiliée iHeartRadio.
Nous mettons l'emphase sur les artistes émergents canadiens pour les rotations musicales.

Toutefois, nous avons une émission de découvertes internationales et nous allons faire jouer votre pièce. 
L'émission s'intitule "120 minutes autour du monde" et est de 11h am à 13h, heure du Québec, du lundi au vendredi.
Votre chanson va apparaître une fois lors de la présentation découverte de la semaine, ensuite elle va rejouer au
hasard des autres épisodes futurs.

Avant que je puisse vous dire quand vous serez diffusé, j'aurais besoin des informations suivantes:
- Votre track (plus simple dans groover svp)
- Lien de votre page Facebook **PRO**  (Important, si vous ne l'avez déjà indiqué dans votre profil Groover) Si c'est déjà là c'est parfait. Avoir une page Facebook est un élément-clé de notre marketing pour vous faire connaître. Il doit s'agir une "Page" Facebook et non un compte personnel.
- Si vous avez une vidéo clip, fournir la vidéo clip également comme 2e fichier: Wetransfer ou service du genre à mtdallaire@notremedia.com

Vous devriez passer à notre émission "120 minutes autour du monde" dans les 30 jours suivant la réception de toutes vos informations, mais pas avant la date de diffusion que vous avez indiquée dans Groover, donc assurez-vous que la date est bonne.

Lorsque votre chanson sera partagée, vous serez avisé.
Il y aura une publication Facebook dans laquelle vous serez identifié et lorsque l'on traite votre dossier Groover, nous vous aviserons également.
Vous serez avisé pour le passage à l'épisode des découvertes, mais pas lors des autres épisodes.
Une plateforme sera bientôt disponible pour vous permettre d'auto-créer votre entrevue et présentation qui sera diffusée.

Merci pour la découverte. 

https://niky.ca ou avec l'application iHeartRadio
(ou sur notre page Facebook https://www.facebook.com/nikyradiointernational/ )

Mysterious, dark, deep. The underground vibes are strong with this one. Unique sound design and choice of pads with the various details. The background behind the vocals are met with sadness and despair, presented to the listener in a disguise of club beat. Interesting and a lot to take in, good job on presenting emotions and art this way. 

However, this is way too dark for my playlists. The vibes feel somewhat unique to me and more fitting to an "underground" playlist focused solely on tech house and/or darker mood. I don't have a playlist for that nor the listeners. Therefore I have to pass this time around.

But I will personally have a few listens to this when it comes out. I found it interesting, your style and production. 

Good luck with your promotion and I wish you all the best //Nawy

Hi End of Code,

Thanks for sending your track over! I really like the overall atmosphere of the track. I think it sounds very professional and catchy. I'm happy to share your track :)

Don't hesitate to send us your next projects!
Bonjour.  Malgré la bonne qualité de ce titre, l ambiance musicale ne correspond pas à mi ligne éditoriale d'Auxois fm. Désolé.  Manuel

Hi guys thanks for the song, the initial sounds and the drum and the vocals are good and well done but the arrangement of the sax is not very suitable it makes the song fall a little, keep it up thanks for asking my opinion see you soon

The vibe of the song is very great, love the groove too. 
In general I suggest you to work more on the general movement of the song, especially on the top end. The main synth needs a little better sound design, especially speaking about the ADSR of the sound, you should work a bit better with cutoff too.

Great song, thanks for sharing!
a very intimate approach of the production. I wish the vocal grip with me more. Thanks for sharing your music.

Hi,

Unfortunately this one is simply too dark for me

The production is nice, the spoken vocals sure not everyone’s taste
I have to pass on this one 
Keep it up 
Greetings from Germany
Thanks for your submission. I'd be happy to share your track on an upcoming Tinnitist playlist when it's released. I'll send you the confirmation and a link when it's done. Cheers / Darryl

Similar like your last track, consistent beats arrangement throughout this track. The mix arrangement in this track is more unique with the vocal too. Alas, I personally feel the momentum didn't excite me much this round.
Hey nice track this isn’t quiet right for our playlist though but we’d like to hear more from you in future Good luck with this one
Hello friend cool track! We will share it on our spotify deep house tracklist. Keep going on best regards.
Hi guys, thanks for this one - good production, no doubt. But we focus on rather melodic ones, also we like more harmonic variations - tastes differ, so all the best with the other guys around here!
Bellissimo brano, aspetteremo l'uscita per pubblicarlo sulla nostra pagina, è favoloso, complimenti per il lavoro a tutto lo staff

Very groovy melodic house vibes and cool vocals <3 the sound quality / mixing needs to be a bit tighter and more polished / refined for us though and the writing feels a bit too repetitive for me at times <3 sorry

Hi, thanks for the submission. The song's concept is ok and the production is clean.. you have an engaging instrumental and the vocals are also ok but, I'm afraid we're currently looking for something more upbeat.. I have to let it go for this time, my best wishes for the release, kind regards!
cool dark melodic house / dance vibes <3 the writing is a bit too repetitive for me at times but we'll give it a shout out on Twitter <3
Thanks for your song vocals good composition interesting and mastering done well but it's not really my style my playlist is very Indie Folk Rock keep it up, thanks for my opinion, see you soon

Hello! Thanks to send me your track. It's really cool! The beat is crazy, the metric with the voice and the bass around ther song is fantastic! Again, thanks to send me your track and cheers from Brazil!

Hello again!

What a blast, guys! This track is a bomb and it absolutely blew my mind! I loved the Progressive House beat with some Techno elements, it really took the song to a deeper level of darkness and this atmosphere fits the vocals perfectly.

I liked the lyrics so much and those deep vocals gave it an extra depth of emotion, it sounds absolutely addicting. I've already listened to the song four times in a row by now and it just keeps getting better and better, much due to the vocals.

The instrumental really amazed me, it has a very dark vibe (reminded me of Township Rebellion), strong and groovy beats, a Progressive House structure and it flirts very closely with Techno too. All that mixed together just turned into a beautiful combination that made this song sound like a majestic wall of sound.

As a Deep/Progressive House fan myself, I liked "Deep Into Your Soul", but I'm completely shook by the sound you guys achieved with "The Fall", this is a masterpiece, no doubt!

I'll be very happy to share this song with my team and on our Twitter, as well as add it on our Spotify playlist soon as it gets available.

Thanks for sending the track, be safe and keep on!

Olá  End of Code, tudo bem com você?
Muito boa sua composição. Essa magia musical é impressionante, cada detalhe de sua "obra" nos conecta muito, realmente essa composição é uma verdadeira obra de arte.
Em breve irei fazer um compartilhamento do seu som em minha plataforma.
Sucesso Sempre.
Se for o seu desejo e quiser gravar um pequeno vídeo para a story, falar sobre o seu trabalho e musicalizar. Gostaríamos de compartilhá-lo em nossas plataformas. 
email: contatomusicalizar@gmail.com
Att
Jonas Souza 
Ceo. Plataforma MUSICALIZAR.

Interesting the way the artist sings the song. Gloomy, strong and making the proposal clear to the letter. At bpm, I think it would shorten the duration a little to connect more with the listeners, but I understand that it was due to the lyrics and not the beat. Congratulations on the work!
Now your music is a guarantee. Each piece amazes and tells a story. Can't wait to get out.

Hello, how are you?

Your music is very well recorded and mixed. The vocal work is excellent and the instrumental work is also very good. Congratulations for the good work.

We are not currently playing this type of music on our radio. However, we will insert your music in one of our playlists to keep it on our radar. If you have plans to come to Brazil let us know. I wish you good luck.

Hello, how are you?

Your music is very well recorded and mixed. The vocal work is excellent and the instrumental work is also very good. Congratulations for the good work.

We will insert your music in one of our playlists to keep it on our radar. If you have plans to come to Brazil let us know. I wish you good luck.
Hey guys, great vocal and this mix is way tighter than last time but unfortunately I feel like this is a bit too dark/energetic for my more chilled list. But send me more as I really like the style!
nice one, adding it to my blog's playlist... very cool groove and nice warm bass. Cheers!
The song has a pretty generic tech house beat and doesn't really show anything out of the box

The lovely hypnotic touch of the track's moody vocals coupled with the dreamy energy of the mesmerizing instrumental delivered a really enjoyable performance overall, but in my view the track could've emphasized its progression a bit more to avoid seeming too limited and short to really stand out in its impact.
Hey guys - a moving set of lyrics for sure! Really enjoy the production but sadly we're not the place dance EDM inspired beats.

This song holds a powerful message. It brings so many emotions out and I can associate the lyrics and the deep house beat with what you have written. This is a great deep house track I love that it is very heartfelt.

Thank you for sending through this piece.

Hey guys, thanks so much for sharing the track with us. I am sorry to decline for sharing it but we weren't into the vocals within the track. I truly enjoyed the beats, production is brilliant but just wasn't sold on the vocals. Felt more an MC style than actual vocals for the tune and this put us off a bit.

Hey there guys, hows everything there? Hope you guys are fine!
We listenned to your track and we digged It. Its not what we are used to work with, but its a good solid track with plenty of market to cover. Good dancing vibes, 90s techno with a little pop vocals, put your efforts on advertising and It should work with time.
Hugs from Brasil!

Thanks for the continued trust and for sharing this upcoming tune. We appreciate the inventive, imaginative electronic music approach. It's chill yet equally brooding. The work has strong synthwave influence as well as techno. Neat and great production especially with blending the elements. For curation purposes, however, ours focus on music that doesn't quite feel steady in terms of buildup. We feel the progression on this track comes off as pretty transfixed in a direction. Best of luck with it, though!

The sound of the song is very good I really liked this one. The message behind the song is very important it’s not easy to open your heart like that and talk about it, I really admire Shawn’s courage.
I will include this song in the playlist of international artists after the official release.
Thank you very much for the contact and I wish you much success.
Hey, thanks for this new sharing. We love it! Are interested by a foodlist on your website : a playlist of 10 tracks about your influencies and this song. Please let us know.

Deep beat and dark vocals are the two premise for this track: both are voluptuous and in constant movement, giving the journey an interesting appeal. The downtempo rhythm gives it a measured picture, impelling for a constant body movement – very poignant for this sort of electro song. It might be a little bit too long but, overall, it’s a good effort.

Hi End of Code.

I am sorry, I just don't really like the vocals.  There also isn't anything special about the melody.  Good luck with everything.

Hi, End of Code!

One more great track!

We'll share it with our listeners that like to workout :)

Keep going with the great work that you've been doing!

Hey guys!

So nice to hear from u all again.

In advance, thanks for sharing your material with us. As said when we heard "Deep Into Your Soul", u guys rock so hard, "The Fall" it's even better and got us dancing.

Would be a pleasure to share it with our followers.

Thanks again for contacting!

Hello and thank you very much for your submission! 
I listened to the song and i think the song is great, especially love that energy inside! 
But unfortunately I think the song a bit too hard and dark for our playlists.
Maybe next time! :)

Hello, End of Code! 

Again we can hear a well-produced song, identifying layers and elements that make this whole album a beautiful piece. 
Though there are the 80s inspired sounds, 'End of Code' knows how to mix retroelements with the 2020s nu house that are becoming so popular on new productions. 
The vocals transport you right into the track, fitting perfectly with the mysterious ambiance of the sound.

A nice track that doesn't ask for too much. The beat brings to you a sunday afternoon by the pool with friends and some drinks. Your job is something that we only can define as an example of Electronic music. You're on the right way!

The atmosphere you create is so enthralling. Really takes the listener to your dimension. Sounds like a goth-ish dancefloor banger that's perfect for late night underground.

We wont be sharing it, however, as we are not an electronic music orientated brand.

Thank you so much for submitting!
Stay coool,
Coolia.
Like so much the beats, send us the press release to post soon on social media and article too
sounds nicely produced, deep and dark. I would play this at the right time for sure - wishing you the best of luck with it - cheers sut byron bay australia

Amazing ideas and sound design here, They are very pleasing to hear but I do feel like proper variations are aswell needed here, The sounds are just tad repetitive in general, Keep it up!

Your track 'The Fall' isn't quite the best fit for the Affinity Ascension network but we do like the backstory to the track so we will be more than happy to support your production this time around End of Code :)

Tech x Techno x Deep Melodic vibes. Interesting elements. The high hats are a bit too present, we don't hear the rest of the song/bass line during the drop. The kick could gain much more presence to kick the song forward (like at 2:02). It sounds more like an add on than a key part of the song. Maybe rework the song to make it more intriguing throughout. Scrolling through the song we have the same feeling, the same elements playing. The higher synth which copies the bass line is high pitched so makes it crowded (watch EQ) and is not necessary - let the bass line do the main job. Use the top layer for something else.

Nice vocals and interesting production but currently not suitable for our promotion!
Keep sending new music

Salut comment allez-vous?

J'ai beaucoup aimé la musique, toute la production, ainsi que les paroles et le rythme, nous l'ajouterons certainement à notre playlist sur spotify

we don't broadcast progressive house or beatport electronica on our radio station, we're sorry.

Hi there, lovely deep trzck! I will share this in my melodic gems playlist thanks for this amazing track!

Hello, good night, we just heard your music and we will give our opinion.
