Interesting main melody on this one! However I find the progression a is so slow in a way that made the elements of the track sound so repetitive overall

Hi there! What a touching story, thank you for sharing. Since it's a dance/edm tune, knowing the back story gave a whole new dimension for your composition. Even though I hoped it could have more intense beat variation through the chorus.

Hello!

Thanks so much for requesting us to review your track. Wow, the bass on this was incredible! The lyrics are dark in context, as mentioned, but the way that they're presented over the track was actually very refreshing. Atmospherically, this was really fantastic. You've managed to create your own little world in the span of a 4 minute track. Congrats on this!

Additionally, we'd love to check you out on Instagram if you have one. Feel free to follow us at ours: @wewriteaboutmusic

Take care!
Hi there. Your song is certainly very heavy and dark and not only because of the story behind the song. I really enjoyed it! Good luck.

I really liked the use of synths and keyboards, they make an interesting bridge to take the instrumental out of the straight line a little.

I found the voice more inside the beats in this song than in the previous one, I don't know if the idea is to release an album with some concept later on, but you could explore more break downs and keyboards in other songs.

We will spread in our networks, big hug!

Sup guys,

Thanks for sending us your song.

As you guys said, it's a very gloomy voyage into the realms of our deepest emotions related to depression and, eventually, suicidal tendencies.

It's nice to see that you both used this past experience to create something that may sound inspiring to others. Very nice indeed!

Anyway, that's all.
Keep up & keep going on,

Best wishes,
RECREIO Clubber

Hey End of Code, hope you are doing well!

Hey, congratulations on another strong release. I have to say though that I enjoyed Deep Into Your Soul better. Although this one is on the same level of quality as its predecessor, for some reason I didn't feel as involved this time. Which is ironic, because the lyrics seem to be more personal. But I think the beats are stronger, the overall vibe is darker. I feel more emotionally distante. I have to say though that it made me dance just as much as the last one.

I  liked the use of electronic beats and the growing number of keyboards and synthesizers, which are taking over the song. The letter is hard, as it should be. Impressive the nocturnal vocals and the atmosphere of tension that is growing.
Hi! Groovy bass :) The top line isn’t a good fit for my playlists though. Thanks and good luck!
Hey! While the composition and production is amazing, we don't accept songs that are mainly electronic, we look for relaxing instrumentals with guitars/keyboard, thanks for sharing and good luck :)

Dear End of Code,

I have to admit "The Fall" has a very strong message that a lot of people could relate to.

And although it's a very solid production, unfortunately it doesn't match my style and top40 playlists.

I'm really really sorry I will have to pass on this gem for now.
Can't but thank you for your submission and wish you all the success in 2021 !

Hello End of Code,
This is simply not the right kind of music for our lists as we mainly promote Dance Pop or EDM pop, this is a bit too Techno/experimental for us

Best of luck

Hey mate! The level of production is amazing! Really well-done production but somehow, the vocal didn't quite work for me. I think it might be just the mix but somehow it felt like a different track compared to the instrumental, sorry.

Thanks for submitting. Pretty engaging track, I like the way it builds with the powerful beats, moody synth layers and melancholic vocal. Overall a well crafted sound but not quite the vibe I’m looking for in my core playlists unfortunately.

Hey, nice track! Very good track, boys! I liked the production. The bases are very well chosen, mixed with different climates. I loved the textures too and the vocal arrangements. Despite the motivation that led to the composition, the energy that passes is quite positive. Will to go out dancing! Congratulations!

La voix est bonne. Il faut retravailler l'instru et prendre des risques... Sinon, on passe à travers...
Thanks for sending. Some great ideas, very haunting. but I didn't connect with the vocals. Good luck with the release.
Quality contemplative electronic music. However, for the type of content we deal with, we would need something with clearer high and lows and rapid build ups.  Thanks ! Dan
Love this kind of "bluesy" voice on a dance beat. Is one of those songs to start a saturday might with.
Salut AGL et merci pour ton envoi, malheureusement le titre n'a pas fait l'unanimité au sein de notre comité d'écoute mais nous te souhaitons beaucoup de succès dans ton projet ! bien à toi

Hi! I really liked your song but I will not be adding it to my playlist because it doesn’t really fit. I will be showing this song to my friends and followers though! Thank you.

Il cantautorato di ''Licheni'' riflette l'influenza di autori come Franco Battiato, maestro per tantissimi. La poetica di questo brano è morbida ed interessante.

Emerge fin dalla prima nota il chiaro riferimento al mondo della tradizione cantautorale italiana. Esce dall'utilizzo della vocalità. Esce dalla scrittura di una forma-canzone ben precisa. Esce da un testo che ricerca la particolarità semantica di un messaggio e delle parole che sceglie di usare. Un buon esperimento che ricorda da dove veniamo tutti.
-
Grazie per averci contattato!
Pubblicheremo questo tuo brano insieme al nostro breve feedback nella nostra rubrica settimanale "Risponde Recensiamo", disponibile ogni sabato su recensiamomusica.com. Sarà nostra premura farti avere il link non appena disponibile.

A presto,
Recensiamo Musica Staff

Ciao Max, intanto grazie per aver condiviso con me la tua musica. Come mi chiedi sarò schietto e costruttivo: ho apprezzato il tuo modo di scrivere le liriche, si vede che ci hai lavorato tanto e bene. Trovo personalmente però che il tuo modo di cantare abbia dei grossi riferimenti a Battiato, ecco io proverei a personalizzare di più il timbro vocale. Per quanto riguarda invece la parte musicale l'ho trovata ben strutturata e registrata ma il mio secondo consiglio è nel provare a ringiovanirla utilizzando una produzione più pop moderna. Magari giocando su suoni più attuali di drum machine e synth. Questi i miei "secondo me", sinceri e positivi. :) Ti auguro in bocca al lupo per il futuro e buona giornata. Gianluigi

Tout d'abord, je m'excuse d'écrire en anglais. 
Dear Mr. Gallet, what a pleasure and a joy to know you!!! I'm a pianist who studied with a Josef Turczynski's pupil (the very editor od Chopin's Works Piano Edition) and me myself was a close friend of Lazar Berman who wanted to give me all the knowledge of Alexander Goldeweiser's teaching... you are a superb and an amazing talented pianist indeed!!! It will be a pleasure to follow you and to share in my Playlists your recordings, i was breathless listening to your Nocturne and also listened to other of your releases like Chopin's 2ns Sonata....what a great and very original Finale (bravissimo!) and also the Fineral March reminds me the masterwork interpretation of Alfred Cortot! I will always share your music, you don't need to write me, it will be and honour and a privilege to follow you. Hope you are fine and I wish to listen to you play live some day in concert!
I wish you akll the good of the universe and thank you once again. 
My best regards

Hi Alain. Firstly, thank you for letting me hear you music. I really appreciate it. However I must say I'm not exactly sure what you want feedback on. Electro-Jazz is definitely not my scene.
Is this a single? an album track? or a submission for background music for a movie or computer game? Personally I don't see any value in this as a standalone piece. 
If you're putting out some examples of your talent as a music creator then this is great, but commercially there is very little that anyone can do with it, with a view to radio airplay. I don't think even the jazz specific shows would give this a go.
I have to stress that my experience of this genre and type of music is very limited, but I have been involved with a station here that used to have a jazz show, and I am positive that this just wouldn't be a consideration.
I do apologise if I seem a bit harsh, but as I mentioned, I',m not 100% sure what you want me to tell you.
However, I do wish you all the best and do hope that your music does get picked up in some format.
All the best, Beefy
==============================================
Salut Alain. Tout d'abord, merci de m'avoir fait entendre votre musique. J'apprécie vraiment cela. Cependant, je dois dire que je ne sais pas exactement sur quoi vous voulez des commentaires. L'électro-jazz n'est définitivement pas ma scène.
Est-ce un single? une piste d'album? ou une soumission de musique de fond pour un film ou un jeu vidéo? Personnellement, je ne vois aucune valeur à cela en tant que pièce autonome.
Si vous présentez quelques exemples de votre talent en tant que créateur de musique, c'est génial, mais commercialement, il y a très peu que quiconque puisse en faire, en vue de la diffusion à la radio. Je ne pense pas que même les spectacles spécifiques au jazz donneraient une chance à cela.
Je dois souligner que mon expérience de ce genre et de ce type de musique est très limitée, mais j'ai été impliqué dans une station ici qui avait autrefois un spectacle de jazz, et je suis convaincu que ce ne serait tout simplement pas une considération.
Je m'excuse si je semble un peu dur, mais comme je l'ai mentionné, je ne suis pas sûr à 100% de ce que vous voulez que je vous dise.
Cependant, je vous souhaite tout le meilleur et j'espère que votre musique sera captée dans un format.
Bonne chance, Beefy

Bonjour, très bonne pièce encore une fois et heureux de vous revoir.

Si vous avez connu l'émission "NIKY International"
L'émission s'intitule maintenant "120 minutes autour du monde" et est maintenant de 11h am à 13h, heure du Québec, du lundi au vendredi.
Votre chanson va apparaître une fois lors de la présentation découverte de la semaine, ensuite elle va rejouer au
hasard des autres épisodes futurs.

Avant que je puisse vous dire quand vous serez diffusé, j'aurais besoin des informations suivantes:
- Votre track (plus simple dans groover svp)
- Lien de votre page Facebook **PRO**  (Important, si vous ne l'avez déjà indiqué dans votre profil Groover) Si c'est déjà là c'est parfait. Avoir une page Facebook est un élément-clé de notre marketing pour vous faire connaître. Il doit s'agir une "Page" Facebook et non un compte personnel.
- Si vous avez une vidéo clip, fournir la vidéo clip également comme 2e fichier: Wetransfer ou service du genre à mtdallaire@notremedia.com

Vous devriez passer à notre émission "120 minutes autour du monde" dans les 30 jours suivant la réception de toutes vos informations, mais pas avant la date de diffusion que vous avez indiquée dans Groover, donc assurez-vous que la date est bonne.

Lorsque votre chanson sera partagée, vous serez avisé.
Il y aura une publication Facebook dans laquelle vous serez identifié et lorsque l'on traite votre dossier Groover, nous vous aviserons également.
Vous serez avisé pour le passage à l'épisode des découvertes, mais pas lors des autres épisodes.
Une plateforme sera bientôt disponible pour vous permettre d'auto-créer votre entrevue et présentation qui sera diffusée.

Merci pour la découverte. 

https://niky.ca ou avec l'application iHeartRadio
(ou sur notre page Facebook https://www.facebook.com/nikyradiointernational/ )

Ciao Danilo! Grazie per la tua submission. Ho ascoltato con attenzione e interesse il tuo pezzo. In me hai rievocato alcuni racconti di Zerocalcare e la cosa mi è piaciuta tantissimo.

Entrando nello specifico del tuo lavoro:

- Arrangiamento e Composizione: 
Il timing di 3:38 è coerente con le logiche più moderne dell'industria musicale, sopratutto nel mercato italiano in cui la tendenza a stare sotto i 4 minuti sta prendendo piede. 
L'arrangiamento è interessante e si lascia ascoltare con leggerezza. Tuttavia sento la mancanza di una vera e propria progressione strumentale e dinamica, che porti l'ascoltatore verso l'ultima strofa. Intendo elementi che si aggiungono man mano in modo da creare stratificazioni sonore sempre più ricche.

- Produzione: 
Il testo è molto bello, vissuto, sincero e il tuo modo di cantare, quasi disinteressato, rende tutto autentico. Mi piacciono molto le tue voci in risposta a quella lead. Ci sono solo alcuni punti in cui sistemerei il timing della voce perchè sembra che vada leggermente fuori tempo. Da "e nun se ricorda mai" c'è qualcosa che non va tra il timing della voce, lo shaker e il "palm mute" della chitarra. Verifica l'autotune o il melodine sui ritornelli perchè sento qualche oscillazione strana sulle linee vocali lead. Sulla produzione della strumentale mi piace l'intreccio delle chitarre e degli ambienti (riverberi) in cui le hai inserite. L'unica nota dolente è il drumkit che a mio parere non è molto coerente con il mood del pezzo. Inoltre la sua struttura ritmica accentua la mancanza di quelle variazioni dinamiche di cui ti parlavo prima. Ho capito l'intento della batteria elettronica ma non credo sia funzionale al pezzo.

- Mix e Master: 
Le tue voci sono ben bilanciate e intelligibili in ogni punto. Buona l'immagine stereofonica. Il master mi sembra molto gentile e rispettoso del materiale sonoro. Non è stato distruttivo e ti assicuro che questo oggi è davvero molto raro.

IL PEZZO MI PIACE UNA CIFRA!

Une chanson française à l'interprétation lyrique au ton narratif et hautement théâtrale. Les arrangements minimalistes mettent l'accent sur la finesse de la poésie imagée de ce titre qui fait vagabonder les pensées avec une =rare grâce. Les images du clip qui l'accompagne propulse les songes dans une univers onirique, avec son atmosphère qui se résume en une sorte de rêve éveillé.

La publication est programmé via la page Facebook le 19 février à 8h sur Montréal. De plus, voici les liens vers les playlists :
https://soundcloud.com/boulimiquedemusique/sets/nuances-franco-shades-of

https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLQQEx2JoJCJvNq3MCR2mn2n_leb_2RUxM

Ciao Cristian! Grazie per la tua submission. Ho ascoltato con attenzione e interesse il tuo pezzo. E’ stato interessante ascoltare questo accostamento di Retro Wave ad un testo cantato in italiano. 

Entrando nello specifico del tuo lavoro:

- Arrangiamento e Composizione: 
Molto interesante il testo. Si percepisce qualcosa di autobiografico e questo rende tutto più autentico. Da un punto di vista armonico è molto coerente con il modo Italiano degli anni ’90. Le strofe tengono bene il confronto con i chorus in cui l’esplosione dinamica e armonica creano un’ottima diversificazione. 

- Produzione: 
Molto interessanti i suoni che hai utilizzato. E’ tutto molto coerente con la Retro Wave. Il drumkit e il synth Bass offrono il giusto supporto a tutta la struttura. L’intervento dei fraseggi ritmici della chitarra elettrica è molto interessante e ADORO l’arpeggiatore che hai inserito nei Chorus. L’unica cosa cosa che avrei cambiato è il bridge. In quel momento avrei cercato soluzioni dinamiche più morbide e distese per dare maggiore enfasi all’ultimo chorus. In alcuni punti è troppo evidente l’uso dell’autotune che, a mio parere non è molto coerente con il mood del brano.

- Mix e Master: 
Il mix mi sembra un po scuro, cupo. Manca di aria nella parte alta dello spettro e questo riduce fortemente la percezione dell’immagine stereofonica. Anche la voce è troppo scura. Probabilmente sulla voce avrei utilizzato una leggera saturazione armonica per dargli aria e respiro. 
Il master è gentile e non esasperato nelle pressioni sonore (questo è un bene).

Il pezzo spacca! Continua così ma fai molta attenzione alla parte di post produzione e mixing. E’ proprio lì che un pezzo ben prodotto può diventare una potenziale HIT.

Hi Lavara :)

My name is Paige, from GNH Records. Thank you so much for submitting It's Time To, to us to consider for our Apple Music + Spotify playlist, Futurepop. It's our home for  "cutting-edge pop acts who nimbly genre-blend with clever, subversive sound design, ultramodern hip-hop or pioneering alternative R&B." It has a rabid cult following which we're very proud of.

Here are the links to follow / share it:
- Spotify: urlgeni.us/spotify/NgzB 
- Apple Music: urlgeni.us/applemusic/7jUt 

I realise it's a valuable use of credits to do this here, so we've taken a very close listen to It's Time To, and want to provide you this constructive feedback on your submission.
 
Opening and grounding the track with that 6 note piano arpeggio loop was great, and once the track and verse established itself, taking it away for the pre-chorus was great, it effectively gave some contrast before the main "get low get low" refrain.

Ultimately, while it impressed us, I don't feel that in this instance the vocal performance was doing it for me. Not that it's a bad performance, it's just that I wasn't really drawn in by a strong earworm pop chorus, it kind of fell away into the territory of an alternative hip-hop, alternative R&B track, without all that much experimental pop flavour seeping through. It's a hard thing to articulate, but essentially this was a FINE alternative R&B/hiphop example, but not quite there as a Futurepop genre track. For Futurepop, we're consciously trying to be a real point of difference, looking for singles that push themselves into a bolder niche, taking innovative risks with more synthetic sound design or atypical arrangements, while still being grounded by very strong pop fundamentals. When you play through the first few artists we've selected for the playlist, you'll hear what we mean. We try to elevate the playlist beyond systemic commercial R&B/pop/hiphop. I think you will easily find some major success with playlists and blogs that do focus on this, though.   

One other thing I can offer you, is a bit of an industry connection. One of our managed artists is Spectoral (@spectoral on Instagram) who co-curates the playlist with us. In fact, it lives on his artist account. So while I can't offer you a placement on the playlist, if you're an artist who is interested in creating music for the bleeding-edge, an artist who is a music addict like us, who shares our tastes, and always aspires to keep tabs on the most current sounds, then I'd strongly encourage you to DM @spectoral - on Instagram. Introduce yourself to him and send him your link. Tell him you spoke to Paige on Groover. He's real nice, a well connected producer and curator from Australia who is a true passionate new music addict himself. He's also a committee member of a not-for-profit (free) organisation called Beat Collective (beatcollective.net) that is one of the biggest artist-producer communities in the world. So he meets a LOT of artists and it's very valuable to be connected. So even if that doesn't result in you getting added to a playlist, you should still get some good value out of at least talking to him, a like-minded artist who values building good industry connections.

Go for it! :)

Paige R
GNH

Tout d’abord toute l’équipe Cul7ure te remercie pour l’envoi de ton morceau « Cours » en featuring avec Simia
Après plusieurs écoutes attentives du morceau voici l’avis que nous nous sommes fait. 

À la première écoute nous étions assez réticents quant au changement de rythme et d’énergie pour le refrain. Mais après plusieurs écoutes nous avons changer notre positionnement. C’est un morceau très réussi et assez chill pour les couplets et le refrain semble être fait pour la scène même s’il n’est plus possible d’y aller actuellement. Le refrain est efficace mais un peu plus d’énergie sur la prod et la voix ne serait pas de refus même si le morceau dans son état actuel est très bien comme ça. La suite semble prometteuse en tout cas ! Donc force à vous et bonne continuation pour la suite ! 
 
Bon courage pour la suite. 
L’équipe 7C

Bonne journée

Bonjour Amurensis, 

Tout d’abord toute l’équipe Cul7ure te remercie pour l’envoi de ton morceau « GTX »
Après écoutes attentives du morceau voici l’avis que nous nous sommes fait. 
La prod drill permet de s’inscrire dans un courant qui semble prendre de plus en plus de place et dont de plus en plus de personnes s’intéresse. C’est une donc une bonne stratégie afin de faire connaître l’artiste. Quant au morceau en lui même. Le refrain est assez efficace et à tendance à rappeler des morceaux de Pop Smoke en particulier Welcome to The Party. Les influences ne sont pas encore totalement digérées mais avec le temps l’artiste devrait être capable de ramener sa propre touche aux morceaux. C’est déjà le cas avec le flow sur le deuxième couplet qui retient particulièrement notre attention par rapport au premier qui se voulait un peu plus mélodieux. Pour une première écoute de cet artiste c’est assez prometteur. Avec le travail fourni cela peut donner quelque chose de très intéressant pour l’avenir. 
 
Bon courage pour la suite. 
L’équipe 7C

Salut,

La prod est actuelle, électronique par moment, énervée, sombre. Lyricalement, c'est très tendance, égotrip, punchs. Le flow est plutôt bien maîtrisé, même si je trouve que ça manque un peu d'intonations, d'énergie. Visuellement, on retrouve le côté sombre de la prod dans certaines couleurs, qui sont aussi mis en contradiction avec le côté "plus festif", des couleurs plus vives, la gestu est déjà vu mais maîtrisée. Force pour la suite.

Hi Sam! Thanks for your submission. 
I listened to your song very carefully and it brought back to my memory some Daughtry’s Song. Your voice is mature and structured. Very Good! 

Talking about your song I'll try to be clear.

- Arrangement and Composition:
The harmonic structure is very interesting and sticks very well with the text. I feel a nice nostalgic mood. The pre-chorus is built very well and offers good supports to the chorus

- Production:
The production is good, simple and strong. Personally, I missed a climax moment. A chorus with a blast of drums, bass, and electric guitars but this is only a personal opinion. I understand what your musical intention was. 
I would like to point out the song "what hurts the most" by Rascal Flatts. In this song, you can listen to the structure and the evolutions in the rhythmic and harmonic layers.

- Mix and Master: 
The mix and master are very good, smooth, and clear.

I hope you enjoy my point of view.

Bonjour Cecri Hony, 

Tout d’abord toute l’équipe Cul7ure te remercie pour l’envoi de ton morceau « 100Ref1 » et la confiance que tu nous accordes.

Après avoir écouté le morceau à plusieurs reprises voici l’avis que nous nous sommes fait.  

La prod drill permet de s’inscrire dans la tendance et c’est une bonne chose à faire. Pour le texte, nous sentons une volonté de dénoncer plusieurs choses comme l’esclavage et les propos de certaines personnalités virulentes de la télévision française. Mais un morceau de plus de 4mns justement sans refrain fait que l’artiste va un dans plusieurs directions et le propos se perd. Je proposerai de faire par la suite des morceaux un peu plus court afin de mieux retenir les phrases « chocs ». Sur un morceau de cette longueur nous pensons qui est aussi important d’avoir ses variations de flow afin d’être toujours attentif. Voilà des choses à tenter pour les prochains morceaux. Soit en raccourcissant la longueur soit en essayant de varier les flows. 
 
Bon courage pour la suite. 
L’équipe 7C

Hello, 
merci de nous soumettre votre premier titre !  

Nous saluons tout d'abord votre travail !
Bien que l'ensemble se laisse écouter, le rendu fait un peu (beaucoup) démo.
L'instrumentale est entrainante et votre flow "embué", mais aussi très rythmés laissent entrevoir les attributs encore en chantier de votre style.
Nous ressentons clairement la jeunesse de votre projet à travers la qualité sonore.
Toutefois nous entrevoyons un une belle marge de progression possible.

N'hésitez pas à nous mettre au courant de vos prochaines sorties (realeases sur les plateformes digitales entre autres), nous restons tout ouie !


A très vite pour la suite !

Hello !

On n'a pas vraiment accroché au titre.

Big up et bonne continuation dans vos projets !

Bonjour, très bonne pièce.

Nous sommes une station de radio/télévision commerciale internationale du Québec, Canada. Affiliée iHeartRadio.
Nous mettons l'emphase sur les artistes émergents canadiens pour les rotations musicales.

Toutefois, nous avons une émission de découvertes internationales et nous allons faire jouer votre pièce. 
L'émission s'intitule "120 minutes autour du monde" et est de 11h am à 13h, heure du Québec, du lundi au vendredi.
Votre chanson va apparaître une fois lors de la présentation découverte de la semaine, ensuite elle va rejouer au
hasard des autres épisodes futurs.

Avant que je puisse vous dire quand vous serez diffusé, j'aurais besoin des informations suivantes:
- Votre track (plus simple dans groover svp)
- Lien de votre page Facebook **PRO**  (Important, si vous ne l'avez déjà indiqué dans votre profil Groover) Si c'est déjà là c'est parfait. Avoir une page Facebook est un élément-clé de notre marketing pour vous faire connaître. Il doit s'agir une "Page" Facebook et non un compte personnel.
- Si vous avez une vidéo clip, fournir la vidéo clip également comme 2e fichier: Wetransfer ou service du genre à mtdallaire@notremedia.com

Vous devriez passer à notre émission "120 minutes autour du monde" dans les 30 jours suivant la réception de toutes vos informations, mais pas avant la date de diffusion que vous avez indiquée dans Groover, donc assurez-vous que la date est bonne.

Lorsque votre chanson sera partagée, vous serez avisé.
Il y aura une publication Facebook dans laquelle vous serez identifié et lorsque l'on traite votre dossier Groover, nous vous aviserons également.
Vous serez avisé pour le passage à l'épisode des découvertes, mais pas lors des autres épisodes.
Une plateforme sera bientôt disponible pour vous permettre d'auto-créer votre entrevue et présentation qui sera diffusée.

Merci pour la découverte. 

https://niky.ca ou avec l'application iHeartRadio
(ou sur notre page Facebook https://www.facebook.com/nikyradiointernational/ )

Je m’intéresse vraiment à la musique, à tout ce qui se fait dans le Game, donc déjà ce qui est sur, je note ton Blaz et je vais continuer à te suivre.

Bonjour 201,

Tout d’abord toute l’équipe Cul7ure vous remercie pour l’envoi de ton morceau « Ce soir » et la confiance que vous nous accordez. Après plusieurs écoutes attentives, nous pouvons vous faire le retour suivant.
Tout d’abord, le choix de la prod est audacieux et malgré tout bien maitrisé. Elle prend un peu le pas sur vox voix et si ce n’est pas une volonté artistique, il y’a quelques petits réglages à faire à ce niveau. En dehors de ça, le titre est vraiment intéressant et apporte quelque chose de nouveau. C’est un peu timide et cela mérite d’être un peu plus poussé pour que vous puissiez créer une réelle identité qui vous soit propre.
Par ailleurs, la cover animée est une excellente idée pour pallier au clip, surtout quand elle est aussi réussie. De plus elle transmet parfaitement l’ambiance du son.
Globalement, le titre est bon mais donne l’impression que cela peut être un peu plus poussé artistiquement parlant pour devenir excellent.
Bon courage pour la suite.
L’équipe 7C.

Bonjour, le projet est vraiment intéressant ! C'est très moderne, plein de couleurs. Le texte est plutôt bien écrit, la prod est propre. Le bémol tient surtout au mastering et au choix de mixage : la voix chantée aurait eu bien plus d'impact en étant travaillé avec moins d'effets, ou alors avec des effets moins reverbe, ici ça donne un ensemble un peu fouilli qui tente d'être en cohésion avec le sample vocalist mais qui n'y arrive pas vraiment.

On est vraiment proche de quelque chose de vraiment sympa et moderne, j'ai hâte de voir la suite de ce projet !

A bientôt j'espère

Gaëtan

Salut, j'espère que tu vas bien !

Hello Wave 21, thank you for your track All over & over.

This is an unfamiliar sound to me, it sounds like a sound that would be big in country music circles or daytime easy listening perhaps.  However not something that would be heard in the UK which is where Im from.

As my preference is short, sharp, loud catchy hook type stuff, Im way out of comfort zone and as such we're not a great match on this occasion Im afraid.

I do wish you all the best for 2021 and hope you can find the audience you need for success.

As we mentioned in our previous review, we'd suggest that the artist perhaps look at some sites that could help improve your song and sound.
There are very helpful sites like Soundbetter and Bandlab where you can connect and work other DIY musicians and producers to help you craft your skill.
Best of luck moving forward.

Le home studio c'est intéressant pour maquetter à la maison tranquillement mais je te conseil malgré tout de passer par un studio pro pour finaliser ton titre.
Si il est déjà prêt tu vas pouvoir l'enregistrer très vite.
Concernant le mixage tu vas faire baisser les coûts si tu arrives en studio avec une maquette déjà bien prémixé comme celle-ci. Si tu connais tes objectifs que tes pistes sont rangées etc ça peut aller vite et tu peux ne pas payer trop cher c'est tout l'intérêt du home studio mais il ne remplacera jamais un studio pro forte heureusement :)

Bonjour Kimberley,

Vous nous sollicitez pour un retour sur votre projet.

Ce qu'il vous manque, selon nous, c'est une bonne connaissance du milieu des Musiques Actuelles.

Qu'il s'agisse de votre manière de communiquer ou de votre titre, ces derniers manquent cruellement de peaufinage (pas de bio, pas de liens vers vos réseaux, l'animation qui illustre votre chanson manque un peu de goût - même si l'on sait que vous avez certainement très peu de moyens pour la créer) etc. etc., et même votre message, est sans doute plus adapté à un réseau de fans qu'à un réseau de pros tel que vous pouvez le trouver sur cette plateforme.

Nous vous invitons à un peu mieux vous renseigner sur comment bien développer votre projet dans cet environnement en faisant des premières recherches sur le Net et ensuite, en contactant le réseau Musiques Actuelles de votre territoire qui sera en mesure de répondre à toutes ces questions : http://www.cooperation-reseaux-territoriaux.org/ 

Cordialement,

CELINE & VINCENT

Hi Knafo :)

My name is Paige, from GNH Records. Thank you so much for submitting Key For A Stranger to us to consider for our Apple Music + Spotify playlist, Futurepop. It's our home for  "cutting-edge pop acts who nimbly genre-blend with clever, subversive sound design, ultramodern hip-hop or pioneering alternative R&B." It has a rabid cult following which we're very proud of.

Here are the links to follow / share it:
- Spotify: urlgeni.us/spotify/NgzB 
- Apple Music: urlgeni.us/applemusic/7jUt 

I realise it's a valuable use of credits to do this here, so we've taken a very close listen to Key for a Stranger, and want to provide you this constructive feedback on your submission.
 
I thought the minimal, held back nature of the percussion here worked really well. It allowed your vocal to build the emotion of the track, underscored beautifully by that keyboard performance. This is a track for afterparties, for drinking whisky, for late night highway drives, for contemplation and introspection. It is an exceptional track and I commend you for the world you built around this with such synthetic sound design slowly evolving by the 2nd-3rd minute.

Ultimately, while it impressed us, this is much too chilled electronic, contemplative, introspective indieelectronic for our playlist. However, I know that this will work for more introspective playlists. For Futurepop, we're consciously trying to be a real point of difference, looking for singles that push themselves into a bolder niche, taking innovative risks with more synthetic sound design or atypical arrangements, while still being grounded by very strong pop fundamentals. When you play through the first few artists we've selected for the playlist, you'll hear what we mean. We try to elevate the playlist beyond systemic commercial R&B/pop. I think you will easily find some major success with playlists and blogs that do focus on chilled, indie electronic acts, though.   

One other thing I can offer you, is a bit of an industry connection. One of our managed artists is Spectoral (@spectoral on Instagram) who co-curates the playlist with us. In fact, it lives on his artist account. So while I can't offer you a placement on the playlist, if you're an artist who is interested in creating music for the bleeding-edge, an artist who is a music addict like us, who shares our tastes, and always aspires to keep tabs on the most current sounds, then I'd strongly encourage you to DM @spectoral - on Instagram. Introduce yourself to him and send him your link (Spotify). Tell him you spoke to Paige on Groover. He's real nice, a well connected producer and curator from Australia who is a true passionate new music addict himself. He's also a committee member of a not-for-profit (free) organisation called Beat Collective (beatcollective.net) that is one of the biggest artist-producer communities in the world. So he meets a LOT of artists and it's very valuable to be connected. So even if that doesn't result in you getting added to a playlist, you should still get some good value out of at least talking to him, a like-minded artist who values building good industry connections. I think he'll love this song.

Go for it! :)

Paige R
GNH

Un brano gradevole e piacevolmente leggero nella sua costruzione orchestrale in realtà complessa ed impegnata. Il canto in francese si adatta perfettamente alla dimensione scelta del mondo musicale a metà tra il pop ed il folk. Ne esce una canzone perfettamente godibile e con una struttura musicale che cattura e si fa ascoltare con piacevolezza senza risultare e suonare eccessiva o invasiva. E di questi tempi non è pcoo...

Hello there. Your track includes nice melodies but for us this is the only interesting thing - our record company releases only edm and generally housemusic genres. Thank you for reaching us.

Hello again PYRONIA! Thanks for sending us Watching The Storm. Just like your last submission, Miss Music, here your groove and dancefloor appeal here was once again fantastic. However, much the same reasoning for our knock-back applies: This just wasn't a pop track for us. Just like Miss Music, this has large expanses of instrumental that work for an electronic/dancefloor number, but as for a pop track, felt underdeveloped and lonely between the vocal parts. If you're going for an indie dance track that doesn't rely on huge pop topline choruses, then this is a success. But it's not a Futurepop track, sadly.

As I said last time though, I would encourage you to contact our managed artist (and co-curator of several playlists) Spectoral (@spectoral on Instagram) While I can't offer you a placement on Futurepop, if you're an artist who is interested in creating music for the bleeding-edge, an artist who is a music addict like us, who shares our tastes, and always aspires to keep tabs on the most current sounds, then introduce yourself to him. He's real nice, a well connected producer and curator from Australia who is a true passionate new music addict himself. He's also a committee member of a not-for-profit (free) organisation called Beat Collective (beatcollective.net) that is one of the biggest artist-producer communities in the world. So he meets a LOT of artists and if you're a social type, it's valuable to be connected. I'll leave it with you. Go for it, and all the best!

Paige

Hi WAN :)

My name is Paige, from GNH Records. Thank you so much for submitting About U to us to consider for our Apple Music + Spotify playlist, Futurepop. It's our home for  "cutting-edge pop acts who nimbly genre-blend with clever, subversive sound design, ultramodern hip-hop or pioneering alternative R&B." It has a rabid cult following which we're very proud of.

Here are the links to follow / share it:
- Spotify: urlgeni.us/spotify/NgzB 
- Apple Music: urlgeni.us/applemusic/7jUt 

I realise it's a valuable use of credits to do this here, so we've taken a very close listen to About U and want to provide you this constructive feedback on your submission.
 
The detail you've put into perfecting those vocal chop points for that drop is just great! It really shows in how the phrasing dances with that synthesized sequence. The percussion comes in and completes the groove, with a huge syncopation that pays off really well. This is a great single for the dancefloor, it's really difficult not to get moving during this thing.

Ultimately, while it impressed us, this is definitely more of an EDM/electronic track than it is a pop song. We tend to avoid high tempo club tracks on our playlist. For Futurepop, we're consciously trying to be a real point of difference, looking for singles that push themselves into a bolder niche, taking innovative risks with more synthetic sound design or atypical arrangements, while still being grounded by very strong pop fundamentals. When you play through the first few artists we've selected for the playlist, you'll hear what we mean. We try to elevate the playlist beyond systemic commercial R&B/pop. I think you will easily find some major success with playlists and blogs that do focus on this, though.   

One other thing I can offer you, is a bit of an industry connection. One of our managed artists is Spectoral (@spectoral on Instagram) who co-curates the playlist with us. In fact, it lives on his artist account. So while I can't offer you a placement on the playlist, if you're an artist who is interested in creating music for the bleeding-edge, an artist who is a music addict like us, who shares our tastes, and always aspires to keep tabs on the most current sounds, then I'd strongly encourage you to DM @spectoral - on Instagram. Introduce yourself to him and send him your link. Tell him you spoke to Paige on Groover. He's real nice, a well connected producer and curator from Australia who is a true passionate new music addict himself. He's also a committee member of a not-for-profit (free) organisation called Beat Collective (beatcollective.net) that is one of the biggest artist-producer communities in the world. So he meets a LOT of artists and it's very valuable to be connected. So even if that doesn't result in you getting added to a playlist, you should still get some good value out of at least talking to him, a like-minded artist who values building good industry connections.

Go for it! :)

Paige R
GNH

Hello Bat Edéaz ! Merci pour l'envoie de ton titre ! Titre super interessant. Le flow est là, le texte c'est très efficace, l'ensemble est propre; il y a un vrai potentiel. L’instru est plutôt classique avec un bon "relief"  ! Il y a des petites subtilités intéressantes dans le texte, dans l'instru et dans l’arrangement c'est cool. Parfait pour les playlist généraliste urban du moment ! Pour tout ce qui concerne l'image que tu véhicule sur les réseaux c'est propre et cohérent , pas grand chose à dire c'est déjà très efficace ! 

Notre label cherche plutôt des artistes instrumentaux ou plus alternatifs dans leur projets musicaux. En revanche nous produisons un collectif de beatmakers sur Paris ( collabs , ventes d'instrus , arrangement , rec , mix ... ) ils touchent a tous les styles , si tu es intéressé réponds moi par mail et je te partagerai leur travail ! Merci encore pour l'envoie de ton titre ! Bonne continuation , musicalement Woogie (Weta Records)

Gosto bastante do conceito e da ideia de misturar as influências todas. Acho que essa banda mostra um pouco do que a banda é capaz, mas sinto que é um pouco datada, sendo difícil se destacar entre outros nomes hoje em dia.

De qualquer forma, não conhecia o trabalho da banda e coloquei aqui no meu radar para acompanhar os próximos passos!

Olá, pessoal.
Obrigado por enviarem sua música.

Gostamos bastante do que ouvimos nessa faixa, logo de cara percebo que vocês tem uma identidade forte com o rock mais retrô, uma bela presença de baixo, backing vocals, existe uma atmosfera e elementos legais que felizmente não se resumem apenas ao conhecido rock indie, mas vai agradar os fãs desse tipo de música também, porém vejo a música de vocês já tem um potencial diferente, a produção é muito boa e está tudo muito bem trabalhado. Vejo que vocês estão em todas as plataformas digitais, o que é muito bom e pode ajudar muito na visibilidade da banda.

Adicionamos a faixa à nossa playlist Groover Discoveries no Spotify e mencionaremos a banda em nossa próxima publicação de novidades.

Gostei muito das vocalizações e harmonias de voz! O instrumental tem um groove muito interessante, flertando com funk, indie e R&B. Como se o Artic Monkeys fosse dos anos 70. A produção está muito bem finalizada. Um som classudo. Fiquei curioso como ficaria esta formula em português.

Antes de tudo: que música interessante! Fiquei bastante feliz em ver uma banda brasileira por aqui e com uma roupagem tão bem-feita como a de vocês.
A combinação de indie rock com soul e jazz trouxe um frescor interessante para a faixa, que não se perde em suas referências e faz acontecer de maneira genuína.
Os backing vocals estão, também, muito bem colocados aqui, colocando a faixa em outro nível e trazendo uma delicadeza perspicaz.
Fiquei encantado com o profissionalismo dessa faixa, bem produzida e redondinha, parabéns!
Colocarei na minha playlist de fevereiro. Quando tiverem um lançamento mais cheio (EP ou album), mandem para a gente resenhar!

Merci pour la musique et l'intérêt. Le morceau est intéressant mais je trouve l'approche un peu 'classique', il est un peu trop droit dans son développement. Il y a de la bonne matière mais le morceau est un peu trop 'sage' en l'état. Bonne continuation !

Hey Keith, 

Thanks for sending me your track. 
I really like it's saucy / barefaced attitude, reminds me to 70's british punk era, and I say it as a compliment. 
However the lyrics are too repetitive, like you didn't have enough words to write. The music is easy going, it would perfectly accompany the lyrics, but the words are nto enough here. The subject was interesting though. 

Wish you the best of luck, 
Eszter

Hello Keith thank you for your track Now Your Life's Gone.

What I appreciate about the track is how upbeat and rambunctious it is, the keyboard effect really adds something cool to the music side of it.

I like your singing voice I think its fun and suits the song.

Lyrically I think the chorus is overdone a little if Im honest.  The repetition was too much for me to really enjoy the track by the end Im sorry to say.

A middle 8 of some sort to break the track up, give it another look and lead into the final chorus with some purpose could be something to think about.

Not one for me this time I'm afraid but I definitely see potential and would be interested to hear what else you can produce in the future.

All the best.
Nice brit rock song! It's full of the energy that comes only from young musicians. The guitars make the listener dance and fall in love
Composition au parfum légèrement anarchique dans sa rythmique et le son choisi. C'est bien écrit et bien interprété, mais un peu répétitif à mon goût.

There is a lot of the vibrant indie rock from the mid 2000s in your track and some influence from Britpop also. Could feel a Jet meets The Subways vibe very easily on your singing and your instrumentation.
Although simple and with the risk of sounding repetitive, this track is direct to the point and that’s all you needed, you have a fast infused track with a lot of influences to showcase, well-produced, great guitars and a voice that combined perfectly with them.
Eager to hear more in the future, longer tracks perhaps. I will add this track to my February playlist.
Thank you for your submission. While very quirky and perky. I feel it's a bit too whimsical, I'd suggest less effects and bit more work on the song writing.

Such an interesting psych-pop/indie rock tune that vividly resembles the late nineties alternative rock era. The number includes high-pitched thematic, which resonates with confident synth tones. The arrpegiated guitar chord progressions are entirely submerged beneath this theme, but they're hearable enough. These arrpegios are becoming full-struming bare chords that are serving as a powerful background during the choruses. Semi-distorted basslines are supporting these chords with a layer of low-end tones that are acting like a compound between guitars and completely stable rhythm section. The synth theme is may sound repetitious and annoying because of the high notes. The chorus should be  less repeated as well, but it doesn't spoil all the fun. Now Your Life's Gone resembles the music of Beck, Kula Shaker, but it can also compared with a  lot of contemporary indie rock acts.

Thanks for sharing this track to us. We like the deep, reflective mood this gives off. We appreciate the inventive orchestration. It feels cinematic at points and gets so absorbing. It's brimming with electronic ambient textures fused with melodic pop tropes. We however feel the overall progression appeal comes off as rather wanting in more holding appeal in terms of its character. Nonetheless we recognize talent here and we hope you continue to hone the craft moving forward. Best of luck with the effort, though!

Hi, Tikom,

Great atmosphere! The vocal performance matches the mood of the track! The vocal timbre suits the vibe of the song! I think the vocal lacks clarity. 
The instrumental sounds great! Great work on designing the various sounds. The beat sounds great. It works well as a fundament for your track! 
Regarding mixing, you do a good job of creating a clean mix. Try to create more dynamic. 
The structure works well and contains a clear and memorable chorus. 
All in all, a great track! Make sure to work on the vocal. 

Kind regards,
Tap Water

Bonjour Mad's,

Merci pour ce morceau et ce moment de poésie.

Au niveau de la production, du mix tout est ok.

Je pense que c'est l'écriture qui demande d'être retravaillée. Ton texte est un peu trop frontal et pas suffisamment subtil. Et pour parler du style, je le trouve un peu trop sage et old school. Quelle est ta cible ? Quel est ton personnage ? Quelles sont tes valeurs ? Quelles sont tes influences ? Qu'est-ce qui te rend unique ? Pourquoi t'écouter toi plutôt qu'un autre ? Pose toi toutes ce questions. 

J'ai hate d'en entendre plus !

Salut,

Merci pour votre envoie.

D'un point de vue technique, le mix est correct mais pourrait être plus poussé, notamment sur les voix et les drums.

Artistiquement, la prod au piano est sympa, ça s'écoute facilement même si un peu de variation dans les arrangements aurait été cool.
Concernant le rap, c'est correct, même si des rimes un peu plus techniques et travaillées auraient été les bienvenues.
En revanche, on n'a pas accroché au refrain chanté.

On ressent en tout cas la sincérité dans votre propos.

Big up et bonne continuation dans vos projets !

Salut,

La prod est douce, mélancolique, peut-être même triste, le piano est une valeur sur pour se genre d'émotions. Lyricalement, c'est un texte conscient, introspectif, pas forcément beaucoup de punchs, mais énormément d'émotions. Les flows sont plutôt bien maîtrisés, j'aime bien l'idée de l'autotune sur le refrain, ça épure le morceau à mon sens. Visuellement, on retrouve le côté "Mélancolique" à travers la solitude du personnage, les couleurs sombres.. Les émotions passent par les plans (la plage, la dame qui tient la main de son petit, le coucher de soleil...). Force pour la suite.

Cordialement,

Hi Julian :)

My name is Paige, from GNH Records. Thank you so much for submitting Strangers to us to consider for our Apple Music + Spotify playlist, Futurepop. It's our home for  "cutting-edge pop acts who nimbly genre-blend with clever, subversive sound design, ultramodern hip-hop or pioneering alternative R&B." It has a rabid cult following which we're very proud of.

Here are the links to follow / share it:
- Spotify: urlgeni.us/spotify/NgzB 
- Apple Music: urlgeni.us/applemusic/7jUt 

I realise it's a valuable use of credits to do this here, so we've taken a very close listen to Strangers and want to provide you this constructive feedback on your submission.
 
With that dancefloor tempo, and your euphoric, strong female vocal lead, this has all the markings of mainstream electropop success. There's tonnes to love about Strangers, from that Royksopp-style bassline to those resonating synth countermelodies hard sidechained to the kick, and those low-formant warped backing vocal accents.

Ultimately, while it impressed us, this isn't the style of music we tend to feature on Futurepop. While this would definitely be among singles for playlists like Cloudkid, MrSuicidesheep and countless others, the uptempo electropop/dancepop genre is something we don't really look for here. For Futurepop, we're consciously trying to be a real point of difference, looking for singles that push themselves into a bolder niche, taking innovative risks with more synthetic sound design or atypical arrangements, while still being grounded by very strong pop + hiphop/r&b fundamentals. When you play through the first few artists we've selected for the playlist, you'll hear what we mean, the tempo is much slower for one. We try to elevate the playlist beyond systemic commercial R&B/pop. I think you will easily find some major success with playlists and blogs that do focus on the aforementioned more uptempo edmPop singles, though. This truly was a great listen even though it's not a fit.

One other thing I can offer you, is a bit of an industry connection. One of our managed artists is Spectoral (@spectoral on Instagram) who co-curates the playlist with us. In fact, it lives on his artist account. So while I can't offer you a placement on the playlist, if you're an artist who is interested in creating music for the bleeding-edge, an artist who is a music addict like us, who shares our tastes, and always aspires to keep tabs on the most current sounds, then I'd strongly encourage you to DM @spectoral - on Instagram. Introduce yourself to him and send him your link. Tell him you spoke to Paige on Groover. He's real nice, a well connected producer and curator from Australia who is a true passionate new music addict himself. He's also a committee member of a not-for-profit (free) organisation called Beat Collective (beatcollective.net) that is one of the biggest artist-producer communities in the world. So he meets a LOT of artists and it's very valuable to be connected. So even if that doesn't result in you getting added to a playlist, you should still get some good value out of at least talking to him, a like-minded artist who values building good industry connections.

Go for it! :)

Paige R
GNH

Salut Meto !
Le clip est très pro : l'image a une belle identité, c'est bien filmé et agréable à regarder. Les images servent bien la musique. 
Musicalement j'ai moins accroché. J'ai bien aimé le début feutré, les percus qui sont très bien enregistrées et qui crée à la fois une vraie proximité (on a l'impression d'avoir quelqu'un qui en joue devant nous) et en même temps une certaine profondeur avec la petite reverb. Pareil à partir de 2min sur les percussions, ça donne du rythme de façon subtile, c'est vraiment réussi. 

C'est quand le refrain arrive autour de une minute que j'ai eu du mal avec la voix qui décolle. Je n'aime pas trop l'intonation qui va dans les aigus, et la voix pousse plus que sur la première partie. Ça me parle moins. Idem sur les effets de voix à 1min30, je n'ai pas du tout accroché. Pourtant niveau production, j'aime bien le "rooming" utilisé sur la voix.
Les cuivres à la fin sont chaleureux, ça apporte une rondeur bien trouvée. C'est bien aussi les petits détails comme à 2min54 avec les notes séparées. 
Bonne continuation, 
Jérémie

Bonjour, très bonne pièce encore une fois.

Avant que je puisse vous dire quand vous serez ajouté dans notre rotation musicale régulière, j'aurais besoin des informations suivantes:
- Votre track (plus simple dans groover svp)
- Lien de votre page Facebook **PRO**  (Important, si vous ne l'avez déjà indiqué dans votre profil Groover) Si c'est déjà là c'est parfait. Avoir une page Facebook est un élément-clé de notre marketing pour vous faire connaître. Il doit s'agir une "Page" Facebook et non un compte personnel.
- Si vous avez une vidéo clip, fournir la vidéo clip également comme 2e fichier: Wetransfer ou service du genre à mtdallaire@notremedia.com

Nous effectuons des ajouts à toutes les 2 ou 3 semaines, mais pas avant la date de diffusion que vous avez indiquée dans Groover, donc assurez-vous que la date est bonne.

Lorsque votre chanson sera partagée, vous serez avisé.
Il y aura une publication Facebook dans laquelle vous serez identifié et lorsque l'on traite votre dossier Groover, nous vous aviserons également.

Merci pour la découverte. 

https://niky.ca ou avec l'application iHeartRadio
(ou sur notre page Facebook https://www.facebook.com/nikyradiointernational/ )

PERFECTION.

Hi VENUS BLEEDS :)

My name is Paige, from GNH Records. Thank you so much for submitting DOLOROSA to us to consider for our Apple Music + Spotify playlist, Futurepop. It's our home for  "cutting-edge pop acts who nimbly genre-blend with clever, subversive sound design, ultramodern hip-hop or pioneering alternative R&B." It has a rabid cult following which we're very proud of.

Here are the links to follow / share it:
- Spotify: urlgeni.us/spotify/NgzB 
- Apple Music: urlgeni.us/applemusic/7jUt 

I realise it's a valuable use of credits to do this here, so we've taken a very close listen to Dolorosa and want to provide you this constructive feedback on your submission.
 
The envelope automation on that raspy synth pad, accented by those sequenced synth drop notes, reminded us of producers like The Last Atlant and Seagram Murals. Both great talents, so huge compliments. This track was dark, brooding, oppressive. When that chorus vocal hit and you changed up your vocal delivery, adding vocoder layers, it really popped. A truly interesting track that held our attention.

Ultimately, while it impressed us, I thought this was more avant-garde, quite alternative, and quite dark. It's subjective, but this, to me, belongs in some incredibly cinematic, avant-garde indie electronic playlists. Not so much a playlist looking for pop songs. For Futurepop, we're consciously trying to be a real point of difference, looking for singles that push themselves into a bolder niche, taking innovative risks with more synthetic sound design or atypical arrangements, which DOLOROSA definitely does, but the thing we also want is the track to be grounded by very strong accessible pop fundamentals. When you play through the first few artists we've selected for the playlist, you may hear what we mean. It was a tough one, though. We still very much enjoyed this, but for different reasons. I think you will easily find some major success with playlists and blogs that do focus on this, though.   

One other thing I can offer you, is a bit of an industry connection. One of our managed artists is Spectoral (@spectoral on Instagram) who co-curates the playlist with us. In fact, it lives on his artist account. So while I can't offer you a placement on the playlist, if you're an artist who is interested in creating music for the bleeding-edge, an artist who is a music addict like us, who shares our tastes, and always aspires to keep tabs on the most current sounds, then I'd strongly encourage you to DM @spectoral - on Instagram. Introduce yourself to him and send him your link. Tell him you spoke to Paige on Groover. He's real nice, a well connected producer and curator from Australia who is a true passionate new music addict himself. He's also a committee member of a not-for-profit (free) organisation called Beat Collective (beatcollective.net) that is one of the biggest artist-producer communities in the world. So he meets a LOT of artists and it's very valuable to be connected. So even if that doesn't result in you getting added to a playlist, you should still get some good value out of at least talking to him, a like-minded artist who values building good industry connections.

Go for it! :)

Paige R
GNH

Hi OTR :)

My name is Paige, from GNH Records. Thank you so much for submitting Pulse to us to consider for our Apple Music + Spotify playlist, Futurepop. It's our home for  "cutting-edge pop acts who nimbly genre-blend with clever, subversive sound design, ultramodern hip-hop or pioneering alternative R&B." It has a rabid cult following which we're very proud of.

Here are the links to follow / share it:
- Spotify: urlgeni.us/spotify/NgzB 
- Apple Music: urlgeni.us/applemusic/7jUt 

I realise it's a valuable use of credits to do this here, so we've taken a very close listen to Pulse and want to provide you this constructive feedback on your submission.
 
It was immediately apparent this was going to be a classic, retro-flavoured live funk number, and when your vocal kicked in, we were strongly reminded of bands like The Whitest Boy Alive, which I hope you take as a huge compliment. This was strongly full of groove, despite its slow tempo, and those whistly synths actually reminded us of early Jamiroquai a little bit, too.

All that said, the unfortunate truth is none of the above is what we look for on our playlist. For Futurepop, we're consciously trying to be a real point of difference, looking for singles that push themselves into a bolder niche, taking innovative risks with more synthetic sound design or atypical arrangements, while still being grounded by very strong pop fundamentals. When you play through the first few artists we've selected for the playlist, you'll hear what we mean. We try to elevate the playlist beyond systemic commercial R&B/pop. I think you will easily find some major success with playlists and blogs that do focus on funk, indiepop, classic/retrowave synthpop, and so on, though.   

One other thing I can offer you, is a bit of an industry connection. One of our managed artists is Spectoral (@spectoral on Instagram) who co-curates the playlist with us. In fact, it lives on his artist account. So while I can't offer you a placement on the playlist, if you're an artist who is interested in creating music for the bleeding-edge, an artist who is a music addict like us, who shares our tastes, and always aspires to keep tabs on the most current sounds, then I'd strongly encourage you to DM @spectoral - on Instagram. Introduce yourself to him and send him your link. Tell him you spoke to Paige on Groover. He's real nice, a well connected producer and curator from Australia who is a true passionate new music addict himself. He's also a committee member of a not-for-profit (free) organisation called Beat Collective (beatcollective.net) that is one of the biggest artist-producer communities in the world. So he meets a LOT of artists and it's very valuable to be connected. So even if that doesn't result in you getting added to a playlist, you should still get some good value out of at least talking to him, a like-minded artist who values building good industry connections.

Go for it! :)

Paige R
GNH

Bonjour, très bonne pièce.

Nous sommes une station de radio/télévision commerciale internationale du Québec, Canada. Affiliée iHeartRadio.
Nous mettons l'emphase sur les artistes émergents canadiens pour les rotations musicales.

Toutefois, nous avons une émission de découvertes internationales et nous allons faire jouer votre pièce. 
L'émission s'intitule "120 minutes autour du monde" et est de 11h am à 13h, heure du Québec, du lundi au vendredi.
Votre chanson va apparaître une fois lors de la présentation découverte de la semaine, ensuite elle va rejouer au
hasard des autres épisodes futurs.

Avant que je puisse vous dire quand vous serez diffusé, j'aurais besoin des informations suivantes:
- Votre track (plus simple dans groover svp)
- Lien de votre page Facebook **PRO**  (Important, si vous ne l'avez déjà indiqué dans votre profil Groover) Si c'est déjà là c'est parfait. Avoir une page Facebook est un élément-clé de notre marketing pour vous faire connaître. Il doit s'agir une "Page" Facebook et non un compte personnel.
- Si vous avez une vidéo clip, fournir la vidéo clip également comme 2e fichier: Wetransfer ou service du genre à mtdallaire@notremedia.com

Vous devriez passer à notre émission "120 minutes autour du monde" dans les 30 jours suivant la réception de toutes vos informations, mais pas avant la date de diffusion que vous avez indiquée dans Groover, donc assurez-vous que la date est bonne.

Lorsque votre chanson sera partagée, vous serez avisé.
Il y aura une publication Facebook dans laquelle vous serez identifié et lorsque l'on traite votre dossier Groover, nous vous aviserons également.
Vous serez avisé pour le passage à l'épisode des découvertes, mais pas lors des autres épisodes.
Une plateforme sera bientôt disponible pour vous permettre d'auto-créer votre entrevue et présentation qui sera diffusée.

Merci pour la découverte. 

https://niky.ca ou avec l'application iHeartRadio
(ou sur notre page Facebook https://www.facebook.com/nikyradiointernational/ )

Maxime

Dear Kane & Joel,

I have to admit "Flying Form" is one of the most feeling-good songs I've heard in a while !
However, there were a few things I would have liked differently; if I may :

a) Vocals felt a bit too detached from the rest of the mix. Not sure if it was because of the mic used or the reverb/delay being different than the one used in the instrumental.
b) Instrumental was a bit too low in volume. I would have really liked it louder !
c) Last but not least, I would have really liked for a more compressed vocal, as at times the volume was fluctuating a bit more than I'd like.

With all these being said, I'm really really sorry I will have to pass on this gem for now.
Can't but thank you for your submission and wish you all the success in 2021 !

Hello Arthur,
Merci pour ton envoi. Je trouve ça plutôt chouette en vrai. La prod est pas parfaite mais ça fonctionne. Si tu veux vraiment donner une dimension pro à ta musique faudra quand même passer un step au niveau du mix sur tes prochains titres. En l'état c'est juste suffisant pour aller choper des retombées web et médias locaux, mais pas assez pour te tourner vers les médias majeurs. Je te conseille également, si tu veux de la portée sur tes chansons et développer ton audience, de penser à un clip. Les titres sans vidéos se partagent très peu, donc c'est important. Sors ton clip, ou un nouveau titre avec un clip directement, et travaille bien les envois pros et promo en amont, et tu verras que la visibilité sera bien plus importante tout de suite ! Si ça t'intéresse, je propose de l'accompagnement sous forme de conseil. N'hésite pas à revenir vers moi le jour où tu auras un single clippé si tu veux qu'on réfléchisse ensemble à comment le sortir dans les meilleures conditions pour toucher le plus de monde possible. 
Bonne continuation !

Si vous avez connu l'émission "NIKY International"
L'émission s'intitule maintenant "120 minutes autour du monde" et est maintenant de 11h am à 13h, heure du Québec, du lundi au vendredi.
Votre chanson va apparaître une fois lors de la présentation découverte de la semaine, ensuite elle va rejouer au
hasard des autres épisodes futurs.

Avant que je puisse vous dire quand vous serez diffusé, j'aurais besoin des informations suivantes:
- Votre track (plus simple dans groover svp)
- Lien de votre page Facebook **PRO**  (Important, si vous ne l'avez déjà indiqué dans votre profil Groover) Si c'est déjà là c'est parfait. Avoir une page Facebook est un élément-clé de notre marketing pour vous faire connaître. Il doit s'agir une "Page" Facebook et non un compte personnel.
- Si vous avez une vidéo clip, fournir la vidéo clip également comme 2e fichier: Wetransfer ou service du genre à mtdallaire@notremedia.com

Vous devriez passer à notre émission "120 minutes autour du monde" dans les 30 jours suivant la réception de toutes vos informations, mais pas avant la date de diffusion que vous avez indiquée dans Groover, donc assurez-vous que la date est bonne.

Lorsque votre chanson sera partagée, vous serez avisé.
Il y aura une publication Facebook dans laquelle vous serez identifié et lorsque l'on traite votre dossier Groover, nous vous aviserons également.
Vous serez avisé pour le passage à l'épisode des découvertes, mais pas lors des autres épisodes.
Une plateforme sera bientôt disponible pour vous permettre d'auto-créer votre entrevue et présentation qui sera diffusée.

Merci pour la découverte. 

https://niky.ca ou avec l'application iHeartRadio
(ou sur notre page Facebook https://www.facebook.com/nikyradiointernational/ )

TR! C's new song "1989" begins by recalling Pink Floyd's classic "Another Brick In The Wall", a hit in the 80's and which inspires the musician. The song evolves into beats and vocal elements that flirt with reggae and Caribbean beats. The combination of different styles creates a rich and original song.

Hey TR!C,

First of all, I've got to say that I'm in love with this tune, stunning and very creative production. And even tho I think the vocals on the verses could've used a little bit more energy and clarity, 'cause it's kinda tricky to understand it sometimes, I absolutely loved every bit of it and I want to write more about it on my page and social media.

There's just some things I'd like you to answer and some things that I think would be great to have:

I'd love to hear more about you, your background and carrer, your inspirations and influences, your thought process behind 1989 and the album and if there's anything planned for you to release soon, may that be another EP, single or album.

I'd love if you could send me the album cover as well and some photos of yourself (if you want to, of course).

I hope we can make this work, I find your music really really good, some of the best and most creative that I have received on Groover.

High regards!

If you want to, you can contact me here or at pareadoblog@gmail.com

Salut, 

Vraiment bien le son, le clip, l'énergie, la vibe, l'univers. Bien joué! T'as commencé quand la musique ? 

Juste un petit détail, parfois des légers offbeat qui me derange un peu au début mais dans l'ensemble c'est clean. C'est bien produit. Le flow non chaland avec une voix un peu usé ca apporte un truc.

Maintenant j'ai envi de te dire que c'est plus qualitatif que beaucoup de rappeurs qui prétendent être expérimenté. Il y a moyen que ca fasse un résultat. 

Pour ca il faudra que tu mettes en place un bonne promo. Ne penses pas label, contrat, signature, tu n'en a pas besoin pour le moment. 

Si tu as une petite équipe avec un peu d'imagination et quelques compétence, tu peux t'en sortir. 

Voila quelques conseils pour gagner en visibilité:

- Freestyle sur IG et Tiktok
- Concours de Rap (1minute2 rap...)
- Publicité payante sur les réseaux sociaux: Fb, Snap, IG... 
- Envoyer au media (via groover ou en direct)
- Faire tourner dans ton quartier ou ta ville en disant aux gens de faire tourner. Ca a l'air bête comme ça mais si 10 personnes font tourner a 10 qui font tourner a 10 et ainsi de suite... 

Bref, il y a pas mal d'idées à exploiter pour peu de budget... 

Je te conseil de la jouer en indé, sortir plus de musique jusqu'a temps qu'un label, manager, distrib ou autre te démarche. Tu seras en position de négocier car ce seront eux qui te voudront et pas l'inverse. 

Taff intelligemment et sois patient.

Si tu as des questions, n'hésites pas. Si tu as besoin de prod, on en parle. 

Dis moi si c'est sorti, je l'ajouterais à une playlist.


Peace.

Dear Adri Lavigne,

a) I would have really liked for a louder low end, especially for a song of your genre !
b) Guitar being panned on the left made the stereo mixed filled a bit weird, as up until the chorus they right side information was missing. I would have preferred for a more centered guitar that stereoized instead !
c) Last but not least, I would have really liked for more body (200-400Hz) on the vocals as well as for them to have been more upfront !

I'm really really sorry I will have to pass on this gem for now.
Can't but thank you for your submission and wish you all the success in 2021 !

Hey Adri. Not sure if you sent this track to the right person here. As my profile says, I am much more into rock and roll and metal stuff. Anyway, since you sent this song to me, I will do my best to share my opinion based on my experience with many kinds of music.

It reminds me a lot of Michael Jackson's first albuns. Not only the voice, but also the instrumental. With maybe a little more upbeat and dancing drums it would be a lot like MJ's early works. It's a compliment anyway, because to me MJ was the greatest artist that ever lived. 

Your singing is very delicated, easy to enjoy. If I were on The Voice, I would totally turn my chair for you. The song is very radiophonic, but the way I see it, it targets an older audience. I dont know what your aim is, but it is not the right way to get into the younger listeners. Or, as an idea, you can invite a remixer for a feat and let him put some beat to the original song. Work on both of them, why not? 

The song is stuck into my mind, so it's catchy. But I really think it targets the older audience wich may or may not be what you are expecting.

Bonjour, très bonne pièce.

Nous sommes une station de radio/télévision commerciale internationale du Québec, Canada. Affiliée iHeartRadio.
Nous mettons l'emphase sur les artistes émergents canadiens pour les rotations musicales.

Toutefois, nous avons une émission de découvertes internationales et nous allons faire jouer votre pièce. 
L'émission s'intitule "120 minutes autour du monde" et est de 11h am à 13h, heure du Québec, du lundi au vendredi.
Votre chanson va apparaître une fois lors de la présentation découverte de la semaine, ensuite elle va rejouer au
hasard des autres épisodes futurs.

Avant que je puisse vous dire quand vous serez diffusé, j'aurais besoin des informations suivantes:
- Votre track (plus simple dans groover svp)
- Lien de votre page Facebook **PRO**  (Important, si vous ne l'avez déjà indiqué dans votre profil Groover) Si c'est déjà là c'est parfait. Avoir une page Facebook est un élément-clé de notre marketing pour vous faire connaître. Il doit s'agir une "Page" Facebook et non un compte personnel.
- Si vous avez une vidéo clip, fournir la vidéo clip également comme 2e fichier: Wetransfer ou service du genre à mtdallaire@notremedia.com

Vous devriez passer à notre émission "120 minutes autour du monde" dans les 30 jours suivant la réception de toutes vos informations, mais pas avant la date de diffusion que vous avez indiquée dans Groover, donc assurez-vous que la date est bonne.

Lorsque votre chanson sera partagée, vous serez avisé.
Il y aura une publication Facebook dans laquelle vous serez identifié et lorsque l'on traite votre dossier Groover, nous vous aviserons également.
Vous serez avisé pour le passage à l'épisode des découvertes, mais pas lors des autres épisodes.
Une plateforme sera bientôt disponible pour vous permettre d'auto-créer votre entrevue et présentation qui sera diffusée.

Merci pour la découverte. 

https://niky.ca ou avec l'application iHeartRadio
(ou sur notre page Facebook https://www.facebook.com/nikyradiointernational/ )

The lovely airy presence of the hooking captivating vocals immediately made for my personal high point of the experience, but I wish the track offered a bit more going for its overall soundscape to seem less limited in its progression to really stand out among all other works of the genre without appearing as too safe to deliver a distinctive impact.

You have a very interesting voice, you should showcase it more and highlight it better in your song. It is beautiful for it to be so shy and mingled between the instruments. Maybe adjust the volume?
Your instrumentation works quite well with what you are singing here also, light guitar and percussion for folk-y songs are always a good call!
Overall, great potential shown here, interested to hear more from you in the future. My advice is to work better on the production to trim a bit those loose ends and have a cleaner outlook with a better volume on your voice, it will suit you perfectly!

All in all, a great track!

Hi Adri, thank you for your track Ma Belle.

Within 10seconds, the upbeat radio friendly nature of the track leaps out and makes itself known.  The music is friendly and accessible.  Your voice suits the music just right too.

Imagine this will be a nice fit for daytime radio.  With the voice you possess, ability to craft a chorus and the perfectly fitting music you will do very well, again just not my style on this occasion.  I wish you all the very best.

un morceau intéressant avec des tonalités qui se marient bien aux sonorités de la prod' ... La structure musicale est bien maîtrisée par l'artiste ... Bonjour, encore un très beau projet ! Le texte est fort, la prod est enveloppante, il y a des bases vraiment solides. Je mettrai un bémol sur le choix du phrasé que je trouve moins cohérent que sur "PUZZLE" et un petit manque de cohésion dans le mastering.

Salut Lexical ! Tout d’abord toute l’équipe Cul7ure te remercie pour l’envoi de ton morceau « Odyssée » et la confiance que tu nous accordes. Après plusieurs écoutes attentives, nous pouvons te faire le retour suivant. 
La production colle bien à ton univers. Malheureusement ta voix et ton flow sont un peu trop monocorde et ton schéma de rimes (avec tes fins de phases en « -en ») s’épuise et devient lourd au fil du morceau. Tu gagnerais à diversifier tes flows, ça te libérerait d’un cadre un peu trop scolaire et donnerait plus d’amplitude à ton écriture (qui est déjà intéressante) par la même occasion. Attention, tu ne rappes pas toujours dans les temps de la production. Le mix est de bonne qualité, mais améliorable. Pour conclure, continue de travailler tes placements et tes flows, et tu obtiendras une bonne base que tu pourras ensuite approfondir. 
Bon courage pour la suite. 
L’équipe 7C,

Bonjour Seleminga, merci de nous avoir envoyé votre musique! Hello, Anna!

Thanks for sharing your track with us.

I was surprised by the intro section and also by the way that you made all the elements gradually evolve and morph between moments of quietness and energy.

However, there were several moments that all of the tension and energy that you've built throughout the song created in me an expectation that a huge, powerful thing was going to happen, but it didn't. That left me craving for more, haha.

With that said, I must ask: are you going to release a different version/edit of this track, e.g. a Club Edit or maybe a remix by another artist?

If you do, feel free to send it to us.
We would love to listen to it.

Anyway, keep up the good work.
Stay safe out there!

Mateus
– Musical Curator & Content Manager

Hello Joe, thank you for sending us your track. I like the intro, it sounds house with a touch of disco and a bit of '80's. "GOD" sticks to it's namesake. Its a funky, lengthy, progressive jaunty ride. There's no doubt GOD would enjoy this jam. I read somewhere she likes it funky! Suitable for mainstream radio (despite the slightly lengthy running time). This is a great track with huge potential in my opinion. Praise be!

Tout d’abord toute l’équipe Cul7ure te remercie pour l’envoi de ton morceau « Hobby » et la confiance que tu nous accordes. Après plusieurs écoutes attentives, nous pouvons te faire le retour suivant. 
Le titre est agréable, la production est classique mais fonctionne. Lors de la première écoute, j’ai trouvé que l’autotune ajoutée à ta voix donnait une impression de grésillement qui enlève de la qualité à ton interprétation. Le morceau devient donc assez monotone. Pour nuancer mon propos, ta voix ne me gênait plus au bout de plusieurs écoutes. Ces effets restent une base que tu dois approfondir, car le refrain fonctionne parfaitement et est entraînant. Pour conclure, malgré quelques petits défauts, le son est agréable à écouter. Pour conclure, tu es sur de bonne bases, continue à approfondir ton travail (notamment tes textes) pour toucher un public.
Bon courage pour la suite. 
L’équipe 7C,
